<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Adam, Seth, Enosh,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared,

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The sons of Japheth: Gomer, and Magog, and Madai, and Javan, and Tubal, and Meshech, and Tiras.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />And the sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, and Diphath, and Togarmah.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />And the sons of Javan: Elishah, and Tarshish, Kittim, and Rodanim.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />The sons of Ham: Cush, and Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And the sons of Cush: Seba, and Havilah, and Sabta, and Raama, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba, and Dedan.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />And Cush became the father of Nimrod; he began to be a mighty one in the earth.</para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />And Mizraim became the father of Ludim, and Anamim, and Lehabim, and Naphtuhim,

<verse number="12" style="v" />and Pathrusim, and Casluhim (from whence came the Philistines), and Caphtorim.

<verse number="13" style="v" />And Canaan became the father of Sidon his first-born, and Heth,

<verse number="14" style="v" />and the Jebusite, and the Amorite, and the Girgashite,

<verse number="15" style="v" />and the Hivite, and the Arkite, and the Sinite,

<verse number="16" style="v" />and the Arvadite, and the Zemarite, and the Hamathite.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />The sons of Shem: Elam, and Asshur, and Arpachshad, and Lud, and Aram, and Uz, and Hul, and Gether, and Meshech.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />And Arpachshad became the father of Shelah, and Shelah became the father of Eber.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />And to Eber were born two sons: the name of the one was Peleg; for in his days the earth was divided; and his brother’sname was Joktan.</para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />And Joktan became the father of Almodad, and Sheleph, and Hazarmaveth, and Jerah,

<verse number="21" style="v" />and Hadoram, and Uzal, and Diklah,

<verse number="22" style="v" />and Ebal, and Abimael, and Sheba,

<verse number="23" style="v" />and Ophir, and Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />Shem, Arpachshad, Shelah,

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Eber, Peleg, Reu,

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Serug, Nahor, Terah,

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Abram (the same is Abraham).</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />The sons of Abraham: Isaac, and Ishmael.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />These are their generations: the firstborn of Ishmael, Nebaioth; then Kedar, and Adbeel, and Mibsam,

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Mishma, and Dumah, Massa, Hadad, and Tema,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah. These are the sons of Ishmael.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />And the sons of Keturah, Abraham’s concubine: she bare Zimran, and Jokshan, and Medan, and Midian, and Ishbak, and Shuah.And the sons of Jokshan: Sheba, and Dedan.

  <verse number="33" style="v" />And the sons of Midian: Ephah, and Epher, and Hanoch, and Abida, and Eldaah. All these were the sons of Keturah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="34" style="v" />And Abraham became the father of Isaac. The sons of Isaac: Esau, and Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="35" style="v" />The sons of Esau: Eliphaz, Reuel, and Jeush, and Jalam, and Korah.

  <verse number="36" style="v" />The sons of Eliphaz: Teman, and Omar, Zephi, and Gatam, Kenaz, and Timna, and Amalek.

  <verse number="37" style="v" />The sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="38" style="v" />And the sons of Seir: Lotan, and Shobal, and Zibeon, and Anah, and Dishon, and Ezer, and Dishan.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />And the sons of Lotan: Hori, and Homam; and Timna was Lotan’s sister.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />The sons of Shobal: Alian, and Manahath, and Ebal, Shephi, and Onam. And the sons of Zibeon: Aiah, and Anah.</para>

<verse number="41" style="v" />The sons of Anah: Dishon. And the sons of Dishon: Hamran, and Eshban, and Ithran, and Cheran.

<verse number="42" style="v" />The sons of Ezer: Bilhan, and Zaavan, Jaakan. The sons of Dishan: Uz, and Aran.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="43" style="v" />Now these are the kings that reigned in the land of Edom, before there reigned any king over the children of Israel: Belathe son of Beor; and the name of his city was Dinhabah.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />And Bela died, and Jobab the son of Zerah of Bozrah reigned in his stead.

  <verse number="45" style="v" />And Jobab died, and Husham of the land of the Temanites reigned in his stead.</para>

<verse number="46" style="v" />And Husham died, and Hadad the son of Bedad, who struck Midian in the field of Moab, reigned in his stead; and the name ofhis city was Avith.

<verse number="47" style="v" />And Hadad died, and Samlah of Masrekah reigned in his stead.

<verse number="48" style="v" />And Samlah died, and Shaul of Rehoboth by the River reigned in his stead.

<verse number="49" style="v" />And Shaul died, and Baal-hanan the son of Achbor reigned in his stead.

<verse number="50" style="v" />And Baal-hanan died, and Hadad reigned in his stead; and the name of his city was Pai: and his wife’s name was Mehetabel,the daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.

<verse number="51" style="v" />And Hadad died.

<para style="p">And the chiefs of Edom were: chief Timna, chief Aliah, chief Jetheth,

  <verse number="52" style="v" />chief Oholibamah, chief Elah, chief Pinon,

  <verse number="53" style="v" />chief Kenaz, chief Teman, chief Mibzar,

  <verse number="54" style="v" />chief Magdiel, chief Iram. These are the chiefs of Edom.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, and Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Dan, Joseph, and Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />The sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah; which three were born to him of Shua’s daughter the Canaanitess. And Er,Judah’s first-born, was wicked in the sight of Jehovah; and he killed him.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And Tamar his daughter-in-law bare him Perez and Zerah. All the sons of Judah were five.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />The sons of Perez: Hezron, and Hamul.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />And the sons of Zerah: Zimri, and Ethan, and Heman, and Calcol, and Dara; five of them in all.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />And the sons of Carmi: Achar, the troubler of Israel, who committed a trespass in the devoted thing.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />And the sons of Ethan: Azariah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The sons also of Hezron, that were born to him: Jerahmeel, and Ram, and Chelubai.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />And Ram became the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab became the father of Nahshon, prince of the children of Judah;

  <verse number="11" style="v" />and Nahshon became the father of Salma, and Salma became the father of Boaz,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />and Boaz became the father of Obed, and Obed became the father of Jesse;</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />and Jesse became the father of his firstborn Eliab, and Abinadab the second, and Shimea the third,

<verse number="14" style="v" />Nethanel the fourth, Raddai the fifth,

<verse number="15" style="v" />Ozem the sixth, David the seventh;

<verse number="16" style="v" />and their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the sons of Zeruiah: Abishai, and Joab, and Asahel, three.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And Abigail bare Amasa; and the father of Amasa was Jether the Ishmaelite.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />And Caleb the son of Hezron became the father of children of Azubahhis wife, and of Jerioth; and these were her sons: Jesher, and Shobab, and Ardon.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />And Azubah died, and Caleb took to him Ephrath, who bare him Hur.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And Hur became the father of Uri, and Uri became the father of Bezalel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />And afterward Hezron went in to the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead, whom he tookto wife when he was threescore years old; and she bare him Segub.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />And Segub became the father of Jair, who had three and twenty cities in the land of Gilead.</para>

<verse number="23" style="v" />And Geshur and Aram took the towns of Jair from them, with Kenath, and the villages thereof, even threescore cities. Allthese were the sons of Machir the father of Gilead.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And after that Hezron was dead in Caleb-ephrathah, then Abijah Hezron’s wife bare him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />And the sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron were Ram the firstborn, and Bunah, and Oren, and Ozem, Ahijah.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />And Jerahmeel had another wife, whose name was Atarah; she was the mother of Onam.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />And the sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel were Maaz, and Jamin, and Eker.

  <verse number="28" style="v" />And the sons of Onam were Shammai, and Jada. And the sons of Shammai: Nadab, and Abishur.</para>

<verse number="29" style="v" />And the name of the wife of Abishur was Abihail; and she bare him Ahban, and Molid.

<verse number="30" style="v" />And the sons of Nadab: Seled, and Appaim; but Seled died without children.

<verse number="31" style="v" />And the sons of Appaim: Ishi. And the sons of Ishi: Sheshan. And the sons of Sheshan: Ahlai.

<verse number="32" style="v" />And the sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether, and Jonathan; and Jether died without children.

<verse number="33" style="v" />And the sons of Jonathan: Peleth, and Zaza. These were the sons of Jerahmeel.

<verse number="34" style="v" />Now Sheshan had no sons, but daughters. And Sheshan had a servant, an Egyptian, whose name was Jarha.

<verse number="35" style="v" />And Sheshan gave his daughter to Jarha his servant to wife; and she bare him Attai.

<verse number="36" style="v" />And Attai became the father of Nathan, and Nathan became the father of Zabad,

<verse number="37" style="v" />and Zabad became the father of Ephlal, and Ephlal became the father of Obed,

<verse number="38" style="v" />and Obed became the father of Jehu, and Jehu became the father of Azariah,

<verse number="39" style="v" />and Azariah became the father of Helez, and Helez became the father of Eleasah,

<verse number="40" style="v" />and Eleasah became the father of Sismai, and Sismai became the father of Shallum,

<verse number="41" style="v" />and Shallum became the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah became the father of Elishama.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="42" style="v" />And the sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel were Mesha his first-born, who was the father of Ziph; and the sons ofMareshah the father of Hebron.

  <verse number="43" style="v" />And the sons of Hebron: Korah, and Tappuah, and Rekem, and Shema.

  <verse number="44" style="v" />And Shema became the father of Raham, the father of Jorkeam; and Rekem became the father of Shammai.</para>

<verse number="45" style="v" />And the son of Shammai was Maon; and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

<verse number="46" style="v" />And Ephah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Haran, and Moza, and Gazez; and Haran became the father of Gazez.

<verse number="47" style="v" />And the sons of Jahdai: Regem, and Jothan, and Geshan, and Pelet, and Ephah, and Shaaph.

<verse number="48" style="v" />Maacah, Caleb’s concubine, bare Sheber and Tirhanah.

<verse number="49" style="v" />She bare also Shaaph the father of Madmannah, Sheva the father of Machbena, and the father of Gibea; and the daughter ofCaleb was Achsah.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="50" style="v" />These were the sons of Caleb, the son of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,

  <verse number="51" style="v" />Salma the father of Beth-lehem, Hareph the father of Beth-gader.</para>

<verse number="52" style="v" />And Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim had sons: Haroeh, half of the Menuhoth.

<verse number="53" style="v" />And the families of Kiriath-jearim: The Ithrites, and the Puthites, and the Shumathites, and the Mishraites; of them camethe Zorathites and the Eshtaolites.

<verse number="54" style="v" />The sons of Salma: Beth-lehem, and the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, and half of the Manahathites, the Zorites.

<verse number="55" style="v" />And the families of scribes that lived at Jabez: the Tirathites, the Shimeathites, the Sucathites. These are the Kenitesthat came of Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now these were the sons of David, that were born to him in Hebron: the first-born, Amnon, of Ahinoam the Jezreelitess;the second, Daniel, of Abigail the Carmelitess;

  <verse number="2" style="v" />the third, Absalom the son of Maacah the daughter of Talmai king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith;

  <verse number="3" style="v" />the fifth, Shephatiah of Abital; the sixth, Ithream by Eglah his wife:</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />six were born to him in Hebron; and there he reigned seven years and six months. And in Jerusalem he reigned thirty andthree years;

<verse number="5" style="v" />and these were born to him in Jerusalem: Shimea, and Shobab, and Nathan, and Solomon, four, of Bath-shua the daughter ofAmmiel;

<verse number="6" style="v" />and Ibhar, and Elishama, and Eliphelet,

<verse number="7" style="v" />and Nogah, and Nepheg, and Japhia,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and Elishama, and Eliada, and Eliphelet, nine.

<verse number="9" style="v" />All these were the sons of David, besides the sons of the concubines; and Tamar was their sister.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />And Solomon’s son was Rehoboam, Abijah his son, Asa his son, Jehoshaphat his son,

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Joram his son, Ahaziah his son, Joash his son,

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Amaziah his son, Azariah his son, Jotham his son,</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />Ahaz his son, Hezekiah his son, Manasseh his son,

<verse number="14" style="v" />Amon his son, Josiah his son.

<verse number="15" style="v" />And the sons of Josiah: the firstborn Johanan, the second Jehoiakim, the third Zedekiah, the fourth Shallum.

<verse number="16" style="v" />And the sons of Jehoiakim: Jeconiah his son, Zedekiah his son.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And the sons of Jeconiah, the captive: Shealtiel his son,

<verse number="18" style="v" />and Malchiram, and Pedaiah, and Shenazzar, Jekamiah, Hoshama, and Nedabiah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />And the sons of Pedaiah: Zerubbabel, and Shimei. And the sons of Zerubbabel: Meshullam, and Hananiah; and Shelomith wastheir sister;

<verse number="20" style="v" />and Hashubah, and Ohel, and Berechiah, and Hasadiah, Jushab-hesed, five.

<verse number="21" style="v" />And the sons of Hananiah: Pelatiah, and Jeshaiah; the sons of Rephaiah, the sons of Arnan, the sons of Obadiah, the sonsof Shecaniah.

<verse number="22" style="v" />And the sons of Shecaniah: Shemaiah. And the sons of Shemaiah: Hattush, and Igal, and Bariah, and Neariah, and Shaphat,six.

<verse number="23" style="v" />And the sons of Neariah: Elioenai, and Hizkiah, and Azrikam, three.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And the sons of Elioenai: Hodaviah, and Eliashib, and Pelaiah, and Akkub, and Johanan, and Delaiah, and Anani, seven.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The sons of Judah: Perez, Hezron, and Carmi, and Hur, and Shobal.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And Reaiah the son of Shobal became the father of Jahath; and Jahath became the father of Ahumai and Lahad. These are the families of the Zorathites.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />And these were the sons of the father of Etam: Jezreel, and Ishma, and Idbash; and the name of their sister wasHazzelelponi;

<verse number="4" style="v" />and Penuel the father of Gedor, and Ezer the father of Hushah. These are the sons of Hur, the firstborn of Ephrathah, thefather of Beth-lehem.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And Ashhur the father of Tekoa had two wives, Helah and Naarah.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And Naarah bare him Ahuzzam, and Hepher, and Temeni, and Haahashtari. These were the sons of Naarah.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And the sons of Helah were Zereth, Izhar, and Ethnan.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And Hakkoz became the father of Anub, and Zobebah, and the families of Aharhel the son of Harum.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And Jabez was more honorable than his brethren: and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, Because I bare him withsorrow.

<verse number="10" style="v" />And Jabez called on the God of Israel, saying, Oh that you would bless me indeed, and enlarge my border, and that yourhand might be with me, and that you would keep me from evil, that it be not to my sorrow! And God granted him that which herequested.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And Chelub the brother of Shuhah became the father of Mehir, who was the father of Eshton.

<verse number="12" style="v" />And Eshton became the father of Beth-rapha, and Paseah, and Tehinnah the father of Ir-nahash. These are the men of Recah.

<verse number="13" style="v" />And the sons of Kenaz: Othniel, and Seraiah. And the sons of Othniel: Hathath.

<verse number="14" style="v" />And Meonothai became the father of Ophrah: and Seraiah became the father of Joab the father of Ge-harashim; for they were craftsmen.

<verse number="15" style="v" />And the sons of Caleb the son of Jephunneh: Iru, Elah, and Naam; and the sons of Elah; and Kenaz.

<verse number="16" style="v" />And the sons of Jehallelel: Ziph, and Ziphah, Tiria, and Asarel.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And the sons of Ezrah: Jether, and Mered, and Epher, and Jalon; and she bare Miriam, and Shammai, and Ishbah the fatherof Eshtemoa.

<verse number="18" style="v" />And his wife the Jewess bare Jered the father of Gedor, and Heber the father of Soco, and Jekuthiel the father of Zanoah.And these are the sons of Bithiah the daughter of Pharaoh, whom Mered took.

<verse number="19" style="v" />And the sons of the wife of Hodiah, the sister of Naham, were the father of Keilah the Garmite, and Eshtemoa theMaacathite.

<verse number="20" style="v" />And the sons of Shimon: Amnon, and Rinnah, Ben-hanan, and Tilon. And the sons of Ishi: Zoheth, and Ben-zoheth.

<verse number="21" style="v" />The sons of Shelah the son of Judah: Er the father of Lecah, and Laadah the father of Mareshah, and the families of thehouse of them that wrought fine linen, of the house of Ashbea;

<verse number="22" style="v" />and Jokim, and the men of Cozeba, and Joash, and Saraph, who had dominion in Moab, and Jashubilehem. And the records areancient.

<verse number="23" style="v" />These were the potters, and the inhabitants of Netaim and Gederah: there they lived with the king for his work.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />The sons of Simeon: Nemuel, and Jamin, Jarib, Zerah, Shaul;

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Shallum his son, Mibsam his son, Mishma his son.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />And the sons of Mishma: Hammuel his son, Zaccur his son, Shimei his son.</para>

<verse number="27" style="v" />And Shimei had sixteen sons and six daughters; but his brethren had not many children, neither did all their familymultiply like to the children of Judah.

<verse number="28" style="v" />And they lived at Beer-sheba, and Moladah, and Hazarshual,

<verse number="29" style="v" />and at Bilhah, and at Ezem, and at Tolad,

<verse number="30" style="v" />and at Bethuel, and at Hormah, and at Ziklag,

<verse number="31" style="v" />and at Beth-marcaboth, and Hazar-susim, and at Beth-biri, and at Shaaraim. These were their cities to the reign ofDavid.

<verse number="32" style="v" />And their villages were Etam, and Ain, Rimmon, and Tochen, and Ashan, five cities;

<verse number="33" style="v" />and all their villages that were round about the same cities, to Baal. These were their habitations, and they havetheir genealogy.

<verse number="34" style="v" />And Meshobab, and Jamlech, and Joshah the son of Amaziah,

<verse number="35" style="v" />and Joel, and Jehu the son of Joshibiah, the son of Seraiah, the son of Asiel,

<verse number="36" style="v" />and Elioenai, and Jaakobah, and Jeshohaiah, and Asaiah, and Adiel, and Jesimiel, and Benaiah,

<verse number="37" style="v" />and Ziza the son of Shiphi, the son of Allon, the son of Jedaiah, the son of Shimri, the son of Shemaiah—

<verse number="38" style="v" />these mentioned by name were princes in their families: and their fathers’ houses increased greatly.

<verse number="39" style="v" />And they went to the entrance of Gedor, even to the east side of the valley, to seek pasture for their flocks.

<verse number="40" style="v" />And they found fat pasture and good, and the land was wide, and quiet, and peaceable; for they that lived there aforetimewere of Ham.

<verse number="41" style="v" />And these written by name came in the days of Hezekiah king of Judah, and struck their tents, and the Meunim that werefound there, and destroyed them utterly to this day, and lived in their stead; because there was pasture there for theirflocks.

<verse number="42" style="v" />And some of them, even of the sons of Simeon, five hundred men, went to mount Seir, having for their captains Pelatiah,and Neariah, and Rephaiah, and Uzziel, the sons of Ishi.

<verse number="43" style="v" />And they struck the remnant of the Amalekites that escaped, and have lived there to this day.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn; but, forasmuch as he defiled his father’scouch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel; and the genealogy is not to be reckoned after thebirthright.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />For Judah prevailed above his brethren, and of him came the prince; but the birthright was Joseph’s),

  <verse number="3" style="v" />the sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel: Hanoch, and Pallu, Hezron, and Carmi.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />The sons of Joel: Shemaiah his son, Gog his son, Shimei his son,

<verse number="5" style="v" />Micah his son, Reaiah his son, Baal his son,

<verse number="6" style="v" />Beerah his son, whom Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria carried away captive: he was prince of the Reubenites.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And his brethren by their families, when the genealogy of their generations was reckoned: the chief, Jeiel, and Zechariah,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and Bela the son of Azaz, the son of Shema, the son of Joel, who lived in Aroer, even to Nebo and Baal-meon:

<verse number="9" style="v" />and eastward he lived even to the entrance of the wilderness from the river Euphrates, because their cattle weremultiplied in the land of Gilead.
<verse number="10" style="v" />And in the days of Saul, they made war with the Hagrites, who fell by their hand; and they lived in their tentsthroughout all the land east of Gilead.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />And the sons of Gad lived over against them, in the land of Bashan to Salecah:

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Joel the chief, and Shapham the second, and Janai, and Shaphat in Bashan.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />And their brethren of their fathers’ houses: Michael, and Meshullam, and Sheba, and Jorai, and Jacan, and Zia, and Eber,seven.</para>

<verse number="14" style="v" />These were the sons of Abihail, the son of Huri, the son of Jaroah, the son of Gilead, the son of Michael, the son ofJeshishai, the son of Jahdo, the son of Buz;

<verse number="15" style="v" />Ahi the son of Abdiel, the son of Guni, chief of their fathers’ houses.

<verse number="16" style="v" />And they lived in Gilead in Bashan, and in its towns, and in all the suburbs of Sharon, as far as their borders.

<verse number="17" style="v" />All these were reckoned by genealogies in the days of Jotham king of Judah, and in the days of Jeroboam king of Israel.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />The sons of Reuben, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, of valiant men, men able to bear buckler and sword,and to shoot with bow, and skillful in war, were forty and four thousand seven hundred and threescore, that were able to goforth to war.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />And they made war with the Hagrites, with Jetur, and Naphish, and Nodab.</para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />And they were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all that were with them; for theycried to God in the battle, and he was entreated of them, because they put their trust in him.

<verse number="21" style="v" />And they took away their cattle; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred and fifty thousand, and ofasses two thousand, and of men a hundred thousand.

<verse number="22" style="v" />For there fell many slain, because the war was of God. And they lived in their stead until the captivity.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />And the children of the half-tribe of Manasseh lived in the land: they increased from Bashan to Baal-hermon and Senirand mount Hermon.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />And these were the heads of their fathers’ houses: even Epher, and Ishi, and Eliel, and Azriel, and Jeremiah, andHodaviah, and Jahdiel, mighty men of valor, famous men, heads of their fathers’ houses.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />And they trespassed against the God of their fathers, and played the harlot after the gods of the peoples of the land,whom God destroyed before them.

  <verse number="26" style="v" />And the God of Israel stirred up the spirit of Pul king of Assyria, and the spirit of Tilgath-pilneser king of Assyria,and he carried them away, even the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of Manasseh, and brought them to Halah,and Habor, and Hara, and to the river of Gozan, to this day.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And the sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And the children of Amram: Aaron, and Moses, and Miriam. And the sons of Aaron: Nadab, and Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Eleazar became the father of Phinehas, Phinehas became the father of Abishua,

<verse number="5" style="v" />and Abishua became the father of Bukki, and Bukki became the father of Uzzi,

<verse number="6" style="v" />and Uzzi became the father of Zerahiah, and Zerahiah became the father of Meraioth,

<verse number="7" style="v" />Meraioth became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Ahimaaz,

<verse number="9" style="v" />and Ahimaaz became the father of Azariah, and Azariah became the father of Johanan,

<verse number="10" style="v" />and Johanan became the father of Azariah (he it is that executed the priest’s office in the house that Solomon built in Jerusalem),

<verse number="11" style="v" />and Azariah became the father of Amariah, and Amariah became the father of Ahitub,

<verse number="12" style="v" />and Ahitub became the father of Zadok, and Zadok became the father of Shallum,

<verse number="13" style="v" />and Shallum became the father of Hilkiah, and Hilkiah became the father of Azariah,

<verse number="14" style="v" />and Azariah became the father of Seraiah, and Seraiah became the father of Jehozadak;

<verse number="15" style="v" />And Jehozadak went into captivity, when Jehovah carried away Judah and Jerusalem by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />The sons of Levi: Gershom, Kohath, and Merari.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And these are the names of the sons of Gershom: Libni and Shimei.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />And the sons of Kohath were Amram, and Izhar, and Hebron, and Uzziel.</para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. And these are the families of the Levites according to their fathers’ houses.

<verse number="20" style="v" />Of Gershom: Libni his son, Jahath his son, Zimmah his son,

<verse number="21" style="v" />Joah his son, Iddo his son, Zerah his son, Jeatherai his son.

<verse number="22" style="v" />The sons of Kohath: Amminadab his son, Korah his son, Assir his son,

<verse number="23" style="v" />Elkanah his son, and Ebiasaph his son, and Assir his son,

<verse number="24" style="v" />Tahath his son, Uriel his son, Uzziah his son, and Shaul his son.

<verse number="25" style="v" />And the sons of Elkanah: Amasai, and Ahimoth.

<verse number="26" style="v" />As for Elkanah, the sons of Elkanah: Zophai his son, and Nahath his son,

<verse number="27" style="v" />Eliab his son, Jeroham his son, Elkanah his son.

<verse number="28" style="v" />And the sons of Samuel: the first-born, Joel, and the second Abijah.

<verse number="29" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Mahli, Libni his son, Shimei his son, Uzzah his son,

<verse number="30" style="v" />Shimea his son, Haggiah his son, Asaiah his son.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="31" style="v" />And these are they whom David set over the service of song in the house of Jehovah, after that the ark had rest.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />And they ministered with song before the tabernacle,  the tent of meeting, until Solomon had built the house of Jehovahin Jerusalem: and they waited on their office according to their order.</para>

<verse number="33" style="v" />And these are they that waited, and their sons. Of the sons of the Kohathites: Heman the singer, the son of Joel, the sonof Samuel,

<verse number="34" style="v" />the son of Elkanah, the son of Jeroham, the son of Eliel, the son of Toah,

<verse number="35" style="v" />the son of Zuph, the son of Elkanah, the son of Mahath, the son of Amasai,

<verse number="36" style="v" />the son of Elkanah, the son of Joel, the son of Azariah, the son of Zephaniah,

<verse number="37" style="v" />the son of Tahath, the son of Assir, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah,

<verse number="38" style="v" />the son of Izhar, the son of Kohath, the son of Levi, the son of Israel.

<verse number="39" style="v" />And his brother Asaph, who stood on his right hand, even Asaph the son of Berechiah, the son of Shimea,

<verse number="40" style="v" />the son of Michael, the son of Baaseiah, the son of Malchijah,

<verse number="41" style="v" />the son of Ethni, the son of Zerah, the son of Adaiah,

<verse number="42" style="v" />the son of Ethan, the son of Zimmah, the son of Shimei,

<verse number="43" style="v" />the son of Jahath, the son of Gershom, the son of Levi.

<verse number="44" style="v" />And on the left hand their brethren the sons of Merari: Ethan the son of Kishi, the son of Abdi, the son of Malluch,

<verse number="45" style="v" />the son of Hashabiah, the son of Amaziah, the son of Hilkiah,

<verse number="46" style="v" />the son of Amzi, the son of Bani, the son of Shemer,

<verse number="47" style="v" />the son of Mahli, the son of Mushi, the son of Merari, the son of Levi.
<verse number="48" style="v" />And their brethren the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="49" style="v" />But Aaron and his sons offered upon the altar of burnt-offering, and upon the altar of incense, for all the work of themost holy place, and to make atonement for Israel, according to all that Moses the servant of God had commanded.</para>

<verse number="50" style="v" />And these are the sons of Aaron: Eleazar his son, Phinehas his son, Abishua his son,

<verse number="51" style="v" />Bukki his son, Uzzi his son, Zerahiah his son,

<verse number="52" style="v" />Meraioth his son, Amariah his son, Ahitub his son,

<verse number="53" style="v" />Zadok his son, Ahimaaz his son.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="54" style="v" />Now these are their dwelling-places according to their encampments in their borders: to the sons of Aaron, of thefamilies of the Kohathites (for theirs was the first lot),

  <verse number="55" style="v" />to them they gave Hebron in the land of Judah, and the suburbs thereof round about it;

  <verse number="56" style="v" />but the fields of the city, and the villages thereof, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.</para>

<verse number="57" style="v" />And to the sons of Aaron they gave the cities of refuge, Hebron; Libnah also with its suburbs, and Jattir, and Eshtemoawith its suburbs,

<verse number="58" style="v" />and Hilen with its suburbs, Debir with its suburbs,

<verse number="59" style="v" />and Ashan with its suburbs, and Beth-shemesh with its suburbs;

<verse number="60" style="v" />and out of the tribe of Benjamin, Geba with its suburbs, and Allemeth with its suburbs, and Anathoth with its suburbs.All their cities throughout their families were thirteen cities.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="61" style="v" />And to the rest of the sons of Kohath were given by lot, out of the family of the tribe, out of thehalf-tribe, the half of Manasseh, ten cities.

  <verse number="62" style="v" />And to the sons of Gershom, according to their families, out of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, andout of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.</para>

<verse number="63" style="v" />To the sons of Merari were given by lot, according to their families, out of the tribe of Reuben, and out ofthe tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.

<verse number="64" style="v" />And the children of Israel gave to the Levites the cities with their suburbs.

<verse number="65" style="v" />And they gave by lot out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, and outof the tribe of the children of Benjamin, these cities which are mentioned by name.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="66" style="v" />And some of the families of the sons of Kohath had cities of their borders out of the tribe of Ephraim.

  <verse number="67" style="v" />And they gave to them the cities of refuge, Shechem in the hill-country of Ephraim with its suburbs; Gezer also withits suburbs,

  <verse number="68" style="v" />and Jokmeam with its suburbs, and Beth-horon with its suburbs,

  <verse number="69" style="v" />and Aijalon with its suburbs, and Gath-rimmon with its suburbs;</para>
<verse number="70" style="v" />and out of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Aner with its suburbs, and Bileam with its suburbs, for the rest of the family of the sons of Kohath.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="71" style="v" />To the sons of Gershom were given, out of the family of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Golan in Bashan with itssuburbs, and Ashtaroth with its suburbs;

  <verse number="72" style="v" />and out of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its suburbs, Daberath with its suburbs,

  <verse number="73" style="v" />and Ramoth with its suburbs, and Anem with its suburbs;</para>

<verse number="74" style="v" />and out of the tribe of Asher, Mashal with its suburbs, and Abdon with its suburbs,

<verse number="75" style="v" />and Hukok with its suburbs, and Rehob with its suburbs;

<verse number="76" style="v" />and out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, and Hammon with its suburbs, and Kiriathaim withits suburbs.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="77" style="v" />To the rest of the Levites, the sons of Merari,were given, out of the tribe of Zebulun, Rimmono with its suburbs, Tabor with its suburbs;

  <verse number="78" style="v" />and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan,were given them, out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the wilderness with its suburbs, and Jahzah with its suburbs,

  <verse number="79" style="v" />and Kedemoth with its suburbs, and Mephaath with its suburbs;</para>

<verse number="80" style="v" />and out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its suburbs, and Mahanaim with its suburbs,

<verse number="81" style="v" />and Heshbon with its suburbs, and Jazer with its suburbs.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And of the sons of Issachar: Tola, and Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And the sons of Tola: Uzzi, and Rephaiah, and Jeriel, and Jahmai, and Ibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their fathers’ houses,to wit, of Tola; mighty men of valor in their generations: their number in the days of David was two and twentythousand and six hundred.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And the sons of Uzzi: Izrahiah. And the sons of Izrahiah: Michael, and Obadiah, and Joel, Isshiah, five; all of them chiefmen.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />And with them, by their generations, after their fathers’ houses, were bands of the host for war, six and thirty thousand;for they had many wives and sons.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And their brethren among all the families of Issachar, mighty men of valor, reckoned in all by genealogy, were fourscoreand seven thousand.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />The sons of Benjamin: Bela, and Becher, and Jediael, three.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />And the sons of Bela: Ezbon, and Uzzi, and Uzziel, and Jerimoth, and Iri, five; heads of fathers’ houses, mighty men ofvalor; and they were reckoned by genealogy twenty and two thousand and thirty and four.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />And the sons of Becher: Zemirah, and Joash, and Eliezer, and Elioenai, and Omri, and Jeremoth, and Abijah, and Anathoth,and Alemeth. All these were the sons of Becher.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And they were reckoned by genealogy, after their generations, heads of their fathers’ houses, mighty men of valor, twentythousand and two hundred.

<verse number="10" style="v" />And the sons of Jediael: Bilhan. And the sons of Bilhan: Jeush, and Benjamin, and Ehud, and Chenaanah, and Zethan, andTarshish, and Ahishahar.

<verse number="11" style="v" />All these were sons of Jediael, according to the heads of their fathers’houses, mighty men of valor, seventeen thousand and two hundred, that were able to go forth in the host for war.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Shuppim also, and Huppim, the sons of Ir, Hushim, the sons of Aher.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />The sons of Naphtali: Jahziel, and Guni, and Jezer, and Shallum, the sons of Bilhah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />The sons of Manasseh: Asriel, whom his concubine the Aramitess bare; she bare Machir the father of Gilead.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />And Machir took a wife of Huppim and Shuppim, whose sister’s name was Maacah; and the name of the second was Zelophehad:and Zelophehad had daughters.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And Maacah the wife of Machir bare a son, and she called his name Peresh; and the name of his brother was Sheresh; andhis sons were Ulam and Rakem.</para>

<verse number="17" style="v" />And the sons of Ulam: Bedan. These were the sons of Gilead the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh.

<verse number="18" style="v" />And his sister Hammolecheth bare Ishhod, and Abiezer, and Mahlah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />And the sons of Shemida were Ahian, and Shechem, and Likhi, and Aniam.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And the sons of Ephraim: Shuthelah, and Bered his son, and Tahath his son, and Eleadah his son, and Tahath his son,

  <verse number="21" style="v" />and Zabad his son, and Shuthelah his son, and Ezer, and Elead, whom the men of Gath that were born in the land slew,because they came down to take away their cattle.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />And Ephraim their father mourned many days, and his brethren came to comfort him.</para>

<verse number="23" style="v" />And he went in to his wife, and she conceived, and bare a son, and he called his name Beriah, because it went evil withhis house.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And his daughter was Sheerah, who built Beth-horon the nether and the upper, and Uzzen-sheerah.

<verse number="25" style="v" />And Rephah was his son, and Resheph, and Telah his son, and Tahan his son,

<verse number="26" style="v" />Ladan his son, Ammihud his son, Elishama his son,

<verse number="27" style="v" />Nun his son, Joshua his son.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />And their possessions and habitations were Beth-el and the towns thereof, and eastward Naaran, and westward Gezer, withthe towns thereof; Shechem also and the towns thereof, to Azzah and the towns thereof;

  <verse number="29" style="v" />and by the borders of the children of Manasseh, Beth-shean and its towns, Taanach and its towns, Megiddo and its towns,Dor and its towns. In these lived the children of Joseph the son of Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="30" style="v" />The sons of Asher: Imnah, and Ishvah, and Ishvi, and Beriah, and Serah their sister.

  <verse number="31" style="v" />And the sons of Beriah: Heber, and Malchiel, who was the father of Birzaith.

  <verse number="32" style="v" />And Heber became the father of Japhlet, and Shomer, and Hotham, and Shua their sister.</para>

<verse number="33" style="v" />And the sons of Japhlet: Pasach, and Bimhal, and Ashvath. These are the children of Japhlet.

<verse number="34" style="v" />And the sons of Shemer: Ahi, and Rohgah, Jehubbah, and Aram.

<verse number="35" style="v" />And the sons of Helem his brother: Zophah, and Imna, and Shelesh, and Amal.

<verse number="36" style="v" />The sons of Zophah: Suah, and Harnepher, and Shual, and Beri, and Imrah,

<verse number="37" style="v" />Bezer, and Hod, and Shamma, and Shilshah, and Ithran, and Beera.

<verse number="38" style="v" />And the sons of Jether: Jephunneh, and Pispa, and Ara.

<verse number="39" style="v" />And the sons of Ulla: Arah, and Hanniel, and Rizia.

<verse number="40" style="v" />All these were the children of Asher, heads of the fathers’ houses, choice and mighty men of valor, chief of the princes.And the number of them reckoned by genealogy for service in war was twenty and six thousand men.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And Benjamin became the father of Bela his first-born, Ashbel the second, and Aharah the third,

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And Bela had sons: Addar, and Gera, and Abihud,

  <verse number="4" style="v" />and Abishua, and Naaman, and Ahoah,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />and Gera, and Shephuphan, and Huram.</para>

<verse number="6" style="v" />And these are the sons of Ehud: these are the heads of fathers’houses of the inhabitants of Geba, and they carried them captive to Manahath:

<verse number="7" style="v" />and Naaman, and Ahijah, and Gera, he carried them captive; and he became the father of Uzza and Ahihud.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And Shaharaim became the father of children in the field of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And he became the father of of Hodesh his wife, Jobab, and Zibia, and Mesha, and Malcam,

<verse number="10" style="v" />and Jeuz, and Shachia, and Mirmah. These were his sons, heads of fathers’houses.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And of Hushim he became the father of Abitub and Elpaal.

<verse number="12" style="v" />And the sons of Elpaal: Eber, and Misham, and Shemed, who built Ono and Lod, with the towns thereof;

<verse number="13" style="v" />and Beriah, and Shema, who were heads of fathers’ housesof the inhabitants of Aijalon, who put to flight the inhabitants of Gath;

<verse number="14" style="v" />and Ahio, Shashak, and Jeremoth,

<verse number="15" style="v" />and Zebadiah, and Arad, and Eder,

<verse number="16" style="v" />and Michael, and Ishpah, and Joha, the sons of Beriah,

<verse number="17" style="v" />and Zebadiah, and Meshullam, and Hizki, and Heber,

<verse number="18" style="v" />and Ishmerai, and Izliah, and Jobab, the sons of Elpaal,

<verse number="19" style="v" />and Jakim, and Zichri, and Zabdi,

<verse number="20" style="v" />and Elienai, and Zillethai, and Eliel,

<verse number="21" style="v" />and Adaiah, and Beraiah, and Shimrath, the sons of Shimei,

<verse number="22" style="v" />and Ishpan, and Eber, and Eliel,

<verse number="23" style="v" />and Abdon, and Zichri, and Hanan,

<verse number="24" style="v" />and Hananiah, and Elam, and Anthothijah,

<verse number="25" style="v" />and Iphdeiah, and Penuel, the sons of Shashak,

<verse number="26" style="v" />and Shamsherai, and Shehariah, and Athaliah,

<verse number="27" style="v" />and Jaareshiah, and Elijah, and Zichri, the sons of Jeroham.

<verse number="28" style="v" />These were heads of fathers’ houses throughout their generations, chief men: these lived in Jerusalem.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />And in Gibeon there lived the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife’s name was Maacah;

  <verse number="30" style="v" />and his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Nadab,

  <verse number="31" style="v" />and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zecher.</para>

<verse number="32" style="v" />And Mikloth became the father of Shimeah. And they also lived with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against their brethren.

<verse number="33" style="v" />And Ner became the father of Kish; and Kish became the father of Saul; and Saul became the father of Jonathan, and Malchi-shua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

<verse number="34" style="v" />And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.

<verse number="35" style="v" />And the sons of Micah: Pithon, and Melech, and Tarea, and Ahaz.

<verse number="36" style="v" />And Ahaz became the father of Jehoaddah; and Jehoaddah became the father of Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza.

<verse number="37" style="v" />And Moza became the father of Binea; Raphah was his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

<verse number="38" style="v" />And Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan. Allthese were the sons of Azel.

<verse number="39" style="v" />And the sons of Eshek his brother: Ulam his first-born, Jeush the second, and Eliphelet the third.

<verse number="40" style="v" />And the sons of Ulam were mighty men of valor, archers, and had many sons, and sons’ sons, a hundred and fifty. All thesewere of the sons of Benjamin.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />So all Israel were reckoned by genealogies; and, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel: and Judahwas carried away captive to Babylon for their transgression.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Now the first inhabitants that lived in their possessions in their cities were Israel, the priests, the Levites, and theNethinim.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And in Jerusalem lived of the children of Judah, and of the children of Benjamin, and of the children of Ephraim andManasseh:</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Uthai the son of Ammihud, the son of Omri, the son of Imri, the son of Bani, of the children of Perez the son of Judah.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And of the Shilonites: Asaiah the first-born, and his sons.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And of the sons of Zerah: Jeuel, and their brethren, six hundred and ninety.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And of the sons of Benjamin: Sallu the son of Meshullam, the son of Hodaviah, the son of Hassenuah,

<verse number="8" style="v" />and Ibneiah the son of Jeroham, and Elah the son of Uzzi, the son of Michri, and Meshullam the son of Shephatiah, the sonof Reuel, the son of Ibnijah;

<verse number="9" style="v" />and their brethren, according to their generations, nine hundred and fifty and six. All these men were heads of fathers’houses by their fathers’ houses.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />And of the priests: Jedaiah, and Jehoiarib, Jachin,

  <verse number="11" style="v" />and Azariah the son of Hilkiah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Zadok, the son of Meraioth, the son of Ahitub, the rulerof the house of God;</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />and Adaiah the son of Jeroham, the son of Pashhur, the son of Malchijah, and Maasai the son of Adiel, the son ofJahzerah, the son of Meshullam, the son of Meshillemith, the son of Immer;

<verse number="13" style="v" />and their brethren, heads of their fathers’ houses, a thousand and seven hundred and threescore; very able men for thework of the service of the house of God.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />And of the Levites: Shemaiah the son of Hasshub, the son of Azrikam, the son of Hashabiah, of the sons of Merari;

  <verse number="15" style="v" />and Bakbakkar, Heresh, and Galal, and Mattaniah the son of Mica, the son of Zichri, the son of Asaph,

  <verse number="16" style="v" />and Obadiah the son of Shemaiah, the son of Galal, the son of Jeduthun, and Berechiah the son of Asa, the son of Elkanah,that lived in the villages of the Netophathites.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And the porters: Shallum, and Akkub, and Talmon, and Ahiman, and their brethren (Shallum was the chief),

  <verse number="18" style="v" />who hitherto waited in the king’s gate eastward: they were the porters for the camp of the children of Levi.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />And Shallum the son of Kore, the son of Ebiasaph, the son of Korah, and his brethren, of his father’s house, theKorahites, were over the work of the service, keepers of the thresholds of the tent: and their fathers had been over the campof Jehovah, keepers of the entry.</para>

<verse number="20" style="v" />And Phinehas the son of Eleazar was ruler over them in time past,and Jehovah was with him.

<verse number="21" style="v" />Zechariah the son of Meshelemiah was porter of the door of the tent of meeting.

<verse number="22" style="v" />All these that were chosen to be porters in the thresholds were two hundred and twelve. These were reckoned by genealogyin their villages, whom David and Samuel the seer did ordain in their office of trust.

<verse number="23" style="v" />So they and their children had the oversight of the gates of the house of Jehovah, even the house of the tent, by wards.

<verse number="24" style="v" />On the four sides were the porters, toward the east, west, north, and south.

<verse number="25" style="v" />And their brethren, in their villages, were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them:

<verse number="26" style="v" />for the four chief porters, who were Levites, were in an office of trust, and were over the chambers and over thetreasuries in the house of God.

<verse number="27" style="v" />And they lodged round about the house of God, because the chargethereof was upon them; and to them pertained the opening thereof morning by morning.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />And certain of them had charge of the vessels of service; for by count were these brought in and by count were thesetaken out.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Some of them also were appointed over the furniture, and over all the vessels of the sanctuary, and over the fine flour,and the wine, and the oil, and the frankincense, and the spices.</para>

<verse number="30" style="v" />And some of the sons of the priests prepared the confection of the spices.

<verse number="31" style="v" />And Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over thethings that were baked in pans.

<verse number="32" style="v" />And some of their brethren, of the sons of the Kohathites, were in charge of the bread of the presence, to prepare it every sabbath.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="33" style="v" />And these are the singers, heads of fathers’ houses of the Levites,who lived in the chambers and were free from otherservice; for they were employed in their work day and night.

  <verse number="34" style="v" />These were heads of fathers’ houses of the Levites, throughout their generations, chief men: these lived atJerusalem.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="35" style="v" />And in Gibeon there lived the father of Gibeon, Jeiel, whose wife’s name was Maacah;

  <verse number="36" style="v" />and his firstborn son Abdon, and Zur, and Kish, and Baal, and Ner, and Nadab,

  <verse number="37" style="v" />and Gedor, and Ahio, and Zechariah, and Mikloth.</para>

<verse number="38" style="v" />And Mikloth became the father of Shimeam. And they also lived with their brethren in Jerusalem, over against their brethren.

<verse number="39" style="v" />And Ner became the father of Kish; and Kish became the father of Saul; and Saul became the father of Jonathan, and Malchishua, and Abinadab, and Eshbaal.

<verse number="40" style="v" />And the son of Jonathan was Merib-baal; and Merib-baal became the father of Micah.

<verse number="41" style="v" />And the sons of Micah: Pithon, and Melech, and Tahrea, andAhaz.

<verse number="42" style="v" />And Ahaz became the father of Jarah; and Jarah became the father of Alemeth, and Azmaveth, and Zimri; and Zimri became the father of Moza;

<verse number="43" style="v" />and Moza became the father of Binea; and Rephaiah his son, Eleasah his son, Azel his son.

<verse number="44" style="v" />And Azel had six sons, whose names are these: Azrikam, Bocheru, and Ishmael, and Sheariah, and Obadiah, and Hanan: thesewere the sons of Azel.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now the Philistines fought against Israel: and the men of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after his sons; and the Philistines killed Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the sons of Saul.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And the battle went heavily against Saul, and the archers overtook him; and he was writhing in pain because of the archers.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Then said Saul to his armor-bearer, Draw your sword, and thrust me through therewith, lest these uncircumcised come and abuse me. But his armor bearer would not; for he was sore afraid. Therefore Saul took his sword, and fell upon it.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And when his armor bearer saw that Saul was dead, he likewise fell upon his sword, and died.

<verse number="6" style="v" />So Saul died, and his three sons; and all his house died together.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />And when all the men of Israel that were in the valley saw that they fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and his sons fallen in mount Gilboa.</para>

<verse number="9" style="v" />And they stripped him, and took his head, and his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the tidings to their idols, and to the people.

<verse number="10" style="v" />And they put his armor in the house of their gods, and fastened his head in the house of Dagon.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And when all Jabesh-gilead heard of all that the Philistines had done to Saul,

<verse number="12" style="v" />all the valiant men arose, and took away the body of Saul and the bodies of his sons, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the oak in Jabesh, and fasted seven days.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />So Saul died for his trespass which he committed against Jehovah, because of the word of Jehovah, which he kept not; andalso for that he asked counsel of one that had a familiar spirit, to inquirethereby,

  <verse number="14" style="v" />and inquired not of Jehovah: therefore he killed him, and turned the kingdom to David the son of Jesse.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then all Israel gathered themselves to David to Hebron, saying, Behold, we are your bone and your flesh.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />In times past,  when Saul was king, it was you that led out and brought in Israel. And Yahweh your God said to you, "You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will be prince over my people Israel."

  <verse number="3" style="v" />So all the elders of Israel came to the king to Hebron, and David made a covenant with them in Hebron before Yahweh, and they anointed David king over Israel, according to the word of Yahweh by Samuel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And David and all Israel went to Jerusalem (the same is Jebus); and the Jebusites, the inhabitants of the land, were there.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />And the inhabitants of Jebus said to David, You shall not come in hither. Nevertheless, David took the stronghold of Zion, which is the city of David.

  <verse number="6" style="v" />And David said, Whosoever strikes the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. And Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />And David lived in the stronghold; therefore they called it the city of David.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And he built the city around from Millo and back to it. And Joab repaired the rest of the city.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And David became greater and greater, for Yahweh of Hosts was with him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Now these are the chief of the mighty men whom David had, who showed themselves strong with him in his kingdom, togetherwith all Israel, to make him king, according to the word of Jehovah concerning Israel.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />And this is the number of the mighty men whom David had: Jashobeam, the son of a Hachmonite, the chief of the thirty; helifted up his spear against three hundred and killed them at one time.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />And after him was Eleazar the son of Dodo, the Ahohite, who was one of the three mighty men.

<verse number="13" style="v" />He was with David at Pasdammim, and there the Philistines were gathered together to battle, where was a plot of groundfull of barley; and the people fled from before the Philistines.

<verse number="14" style="v" />And they stood in the midst of the plot, and defended it, and killed the Philistines; and Jehovah saved them by a greatvictory.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="15" style="v" />And three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the host of thePhilistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Beth-lehem.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And David longed, and said, Oh that one would give me water to drink of the well of Beth-lehem, which is by the gate!</para>

<verse number="18" style="v" />And the three brake through the host of the Philistines, and drew water out of the well of Beth-lehem, that was by thegate, and took it, and brought it to David: but David would not drink thereof, but poured it out to Jehovah,

<verse number="19" style="v" />and said, My God forbid it me, that I should do this: shall I drink the blood of these men that have put their lives injeopardy? for with the jeopardy of their lives they brought it. Therefore he would not drink it. These things did thethree mighty men.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And Abishai, the brother of Joab, he was chief of the three; for he lifted up his spear against three hundred and killedthem, and had a name among the three.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Of the three, he was more honorable than the two, and was made their captain: howbeit he attained not to thefirst three.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, the son of a valiant man of Kabzeel, who had done mighty deeds, he killed the twosons of Ariel of Moab: he went down also and killed a lion in the midst of a pit in time of snow.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />And he killed an Egyptian, a man of great stature, five cubits high; and in the Egyptian’s hand was a spear like a weaver’sbeam; and he went down to him with a staff, and plucked the spear out of the Egyptian’s hand, and killed him with his own spear.</para>

<verse number="24" style="v" />These things did Benaiah the son of Jehoiada, and had a name among the three mighty men.

<verse number="25" style="v" />Behold, he was more honorable than the thirty, but he attained not to thefirst three: and David set him over his guard.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Also the mighty men of the armies: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan the son of Dodo of Beth-lehem,

  <verse number="27" style="v" />Shammoth the Harorite, Helez the Pelonite,

  <verse number="28" style="v" />Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite, Abiezer the Anathothite,

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Sibbecai the Hushathite, Ilai the Ahohite,</para>

<verse number="30" style="v" />Maharai the Netophathite, Heled the son of Baanah the Netophathite,

<verse number="31" style="v" />Ithai the son of Ribai of Gibeah of the children of Benjamin, Benaiah the Pirathonite,

<verse number="32" style="v" />Hurai of the brooks of Gaash, Abiel the Arbathite,

<verse number="33" style="v" />Azmaveth the Baharumite, Eliahba the Shaalbonite,

<verse number="34" style="v" />the sons of Hashem the Gizonite, Jonathan the son of Shagee the Hararite,

<verse number="35" style="v" />Ahiam the son of Sacar the Hararite, Eliphal the son of Ur,

<verse number="36" style="v" />Hepher the Mecherathite, Ahijah the Pelonite,

<verse number="37" style="v" />Hezro the Carmelite, Naarai the son of Ezbai,

<verse number="38" style="v" />Joel the brother of Nathan, Mibhar the son of Hagri,

<verse number="39" style="v" />Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Berothite, the armorbearer of Joab the son of Zeruiah,

<verse number="40" style="v" />Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite,

<verse number="41" style="v" />Uriah the Hittite, Zabad the son of Ahlai,

<verse number="42" style="v" />Adina the son of Shiza the Reubenite, a chief of the Reubenites, and thirty with him,

<verse number="43" style="v" />Hanan the son of Maacah, and Joshaphat the Mithnite,

<verse number="44" style="v" />Uzzia the Ashterathite, Shama and Jeiel the sons of Hotham the Aroerite,

<verse number="45" style="v" />Jediael the son of Shimri, and Joha his brother, the Tizite,

<verse number="46" style="v" />Eliel the Mahavite, and Jeribai, and Joshaviah, the sons of Elnaam, and Ithmah the Moabite,

<verse number="47" style="v" />Eliel, and Obed, and Jaasiel the Mezobaite.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now these are they that came to David to Ziklag, while he yet kept himself close because of Saul the son of Kish; and theywere among the mighty men, his helpers in war.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />They were armed with bows, and could use both the right hand and the left in slinging stones and in shooting arrows fromthe bow: they were of Saul’s brethren of Benjamin.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />The chief was Ahiezer; then Joash, the sons of Shemaah the Gibeathite, and Jeziel, and Pelet, the sons of Azmaveth, andBeracah, and Jehu the Anathothite,

<verse number="4" style="v" />and Ishmaiah the Gibeonite, a mighty man among the thirty, and over the thirty, and Jeremiah, and Jahaziel, and Johanan,and Jozabad the Gederathite,

<verse number="5" style="v" />Eluzai, and Jerimoth, and Bealiah, and Shemariah, and Shephatiah the Haruphite,

<verse number="6" style="v" />Elkanah, and Isshiah, and Azarel, and Joezer, and Jashobeam, the Korahites,

<verse number="7" style="v" />and Joelah, and Zebadiah, the sons of Jeroham of Gedor.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />And of the Gadites there separated themselves to David to the stronghold in the wilderness, mighty men of valor, mentrained for war, that could handle shield and spear; whose faces were like the faces of lions, and they were as swift as theroes upon the mountains:</para>

<verse number="9" style="v" />Ezer the chief, Obadiah the second, Eliab the third,

<verse number="10" style="v" />Mishmannah the fourth, Jeremiah the fifth,

<verse number="11" style="v" />Attai the sixth, Eliel the seventh,

<verse number="12" style="v" />Johanan the eighth, Elzabad the ninth,

<verse number="13" style="v" />Jeremiah the tenth, Machbannai the eleventh.

<verse number="14" style="v" />These of the sons of Gad were captains of the host: he that was least was equal to a hundred, and the greatest to athousand.

<verse number="15" style="v" />These are they that went over the Jordan in the first month, when it had overflowed all its banks; and they put to flightall them of the valleys, both toward the east and toward the west.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And there came of the children of Benjamin and Judah to the stronghold to David.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And David went out to meet them, and answered and said to them, If you be come peaceably to me to help me, my heartshall be knit to you; but if you be come to betray me to mine adversaries, seeing there is no wrong in my hands, theGod of our fathers look thereon, and rebuke it.</para>

<verse number="18" style="v" />Then the Spirit came upon Amasai, who was chief of the thirty,and he said, Your are we, David, and on your side, you son of Jesse: peace, peace be to thee, and peace be to yourhelpers; for your God helps thee. Then David received them, and made them captains of the band.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Of Manasseh also there fell away some to David, when he came with the Philistines against Saul to battle: but they helpedthem not; for the lords of the Philistines upon advisement sent him away, saying, He will fall away to his master Saul to thejeopardy of our heads.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />As he went to Ziklag, there fell to him of Manasseh, Adnah, and Jozabad, and Jediael, and Michael, and Jozabad, andElihu, and Zillethai, captains of thousands that were of Manasseh.</para>

<verse number="21" style="v" />And they helped David against the band of rovers: for they were all mighty men of valor, and were captains in the host.

<verse number="22" style="v" />For from day to day men came to David to help him, until there was a great host, like the host of God.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="23" style="v" />And these are the numbers of the heads of them that were armed for war, who came to David to Hebron, to turn the kingdomof Saul to him, according to the word of Jehovah.

  <verse number="24" style="v" />The children of Judah that bare shield and spear were six thousand and eight hundred, armed for war.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />Of the children of Simeon, mighty men of valor for the war, seven thousand and one hundred.</para>

<verse number="26" style="v" />Of the children of Levi four thousand and six hundred.

<verse number="27" style="v" />And Jehoiada was the leader of the house of Aaron; and with him were three thousand and seven hundred,

<verse number="28" style="v" />and Zadok, a young man mighty of valor, and of his father’s house twenty and two captains.

<verse number="29" style="v" />And of the children of Benjamin, the brethren of Saul, three thousand: for hitherto the greatest part of them had kepttheir allegiance to the house of Saul.

<verse number="30" style="v" />And of the children of Ephraim twenty thousand and eight hundred, mighty men of valor, famous men in their fathers’houses.

<verse number="31" style="v" />And of the half-tribe of Manasseh eighteen thousand, who were mentioned by name, to come and make David king.

<verse number="32" style="v" />And of the children of Issachar, men that had understanding of the times, to know what Israel ought to do, the heads ofthem were two hundred; and all their brethren were at their commandment.

<verse number="33" style="v" />Of Zebulun, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, with all manner of instrumentsof war, fifty thousand, and that could order the battle array, andwere not of double heart.

<verse number="34" style="v" />And of Naphtali a thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty and seven thousand.

<verse number="35" style="v" />And of the Danites that could set the battle in array, twenty and eight thousand and six hundred.

<verse number="36" style="v" />And of Asher, such as were able to go out in the host, that could set the battle in array, forty thousand.

<verse number="37" style="v" />And on the other side of the Jordan, of the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and of the half-tribe of Manasseh, with allmanner of instruments of war for the battle, a hundred and twenty thousand.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="38" style="v" />All these, being men of war, that could order the battle array, came with a perfect heart to Hebron, to make David kingover all Israel: and all the rest also of Israel were of one heart to make David king.

  <verse number="39" style="v" />And they were there with David three days, eating and drinking; for their brethren had made preparation for them.

  <verse number="40" style="v" />Moreover they that were near to them, even as far as Issachar and Zebulun and Naphtali, brought bread onasses, and on camels, and on mules, and on oxen, food of meal, cakes of figs, and clusters of raisins, and wine, and oil,and oxen, and sheep in abundance: for there was joy in Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And David consulted with the captains of thousands and of hundreds, even with every leader.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And David said to all the assembly of Israel, If it seem good to you, and if it be of Jehovah our God, let us sendabroad every where to our brethren that are left in all the land of Israel, with whom the priests and Levites are in theircities that have suburbs, that they may gather themselves to us;

  <verse number="3" style="v" />and let us bring again the ark of our God to us: for we sought not to it in the days of Saul.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And all the assembly said that they would do so; for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people.</para>

<verse number="5" style="v" />So David assembled all Israel together, from the Shihor the brookof Egypt even to the entrance of Hamath, to bring the ark of God from Kiriath-jearim.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And David went up, and all Israel, to Baalah, that is, to Kiriath-jearim, which belonged to Judah, to bring upfrom thence the ark of God Jehovah that sits above the cherubim, that is called by the Name.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And they carried the ark of God upon a new cart, and brought itout of the house of Abinadab: and Uzza and Ahio drove the cart.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, and with harps, and with psalteries, andwith timbrels, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And when they came to the threshing floor of Chidon, Uzza put forth his hand to hold the ark; for the oxen stumbled.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />And the anger of Jehovah was kindled against Uzza, and he struck him, because he put forth his hand to the ark; and therehe died before God.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />And David was displeased, because Jehovah had broken forth upon Uzza: and he called that place Perez-uzza, to this day.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />And David was afraid of God that day, saying, How shall I bring the ark of God home to me?

<verse number="13" style="v" />So David removed not the ark to him into the city of David, but carried it aside into the house of Obed-edom theGittite.

<verse number="14" style="v" />And the ark of God remained with the family of Obed-edom in his house three months: and Jehovah blessed the house ofObed-edom, and all that he had.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, and cedar-trees, and masons, and carpenters, to build him a house.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And David knew that Yahweh had established him as king over Israel; for his kingdom was exalted on high, for the sake of his people Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And David took more wives at Jerusalem; and David became the father of more sons and daughters.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And these are the names of the children whom he had in Jerusalem: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Ibhar, Elishua, Elpelet,

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Nogah, Nepheg, Japhia,

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Elishama, Beeliada, and Eliphelet.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="8" style="v" />And when the Philistines heard that David was anointed king over all Israel, all the Philistines went up to seek David. But  David heard of it, and went out against them.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Now the Philistines had come and made a raid in the valley of Rephaim.</para>

<verse number="10" style="v" />And David inquired of God, saying, Shall I go up against the Philistines? And will you deliver them into my hand? AndYahweh said to him, "Go up; for I will deliver them into your hand."

<verse number="11" style="v" />So they came up to Baal-perazim, and David struck them there; and David said, "God has broken mine enemies by my hand, like the bursting flood of waters." Therefore they called the name of that place Baal-perazim.

<verse number="12" style="v" />And they left their gods there; and David gave commandment, and they were burned with fire.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="13" style="v" />And the Philistines yet again made a raid in the valley.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />And David inquired again of God; and God said to him, "You shall not go up after them: turn away from them, and come upon them in front of the balsam-trees.</para>

<verse number="15" style="v" />And it shall be, when you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam-trees, that then you shall go outto battle; for God has gone out before you to strike the army of the Philistines."

<verse number="16" style="v" />And David did as God commanded him: and they struck the army of the Philistines from Gibeon even to Gezer.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And the fame of David went out into all lands; and Jehovah brought the fear of him upon all nations.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And David made him houses in the city of David; and he prepared a place for the ark of God, and pitched for it atent.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them has Jehovah chosen to carry the ark of God,and to minister to him for ever.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And David assembled all Israel at Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of Jehovah to its place, which he had prepared for it.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />And David gathered together the sons of Aaron, and the Levites:

<verse number="5" style="v" />of the sons of Kohath, Uriel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twenty;

<verse number="6" style="v" />of the sons of Merari, Asaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred and twenty;

<verse number="7" style="v" />of the sons of Gershom, Joel the chief, and his brethren a hundred and thirty;

<verse number="8" style="v" />of the sons of Elizaphan, Shemaiah the chief, and his brethren two hundred;

<verse number="9" style="v" />of the sons of Hebron, Eliel the chief, and his brethren fourscore;

<verse number="10" style="v" />of the sons of Uzziel, Amminadab the chief, and his brethren a hundred and twelve.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And David called for Zadok and Abiathar the priests, and for the Levites, for Uriel, Asaiah, and Joel, Shemaiah, andEliel, and Amminadab,

<verse number="12" style="v" />and said to them, You are the heads of the fathers’ housesof the Levites: sanctify yourselves, both you and your brethren, that you may bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God ofIsrael, to the place that I have prepared for it.

<verse number="13" style="v" />For because you bare it not at the first, Jehovah our God made a breach upon us, for that we sought him notaccording to the ordinance.

<verse number="14" style="v" />So the priests and the Levites sanctified themselves to bring up the ark of Jehovah, the God of Israel.

<verse number="15" style="v" />And the children of the Levites bare the ark of God upon their shoulders with the staves thereon, as Moses commandedaccording to the word of Jehovah.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And David spoke to the chief of the Levites to appoint their brethren the singers, with instruments of music, lutesand harps and cymbals, sounding aloud and lifting up the voice with joy.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />So the Levites appointed Heman the son of Joel; and of his brethren, Asaph the son of Berechiah; and of the sons ofMerari their brethren, Ethan the son of Kushaiah;

  <verse number="18" style="v" />and with them their brethren of the second degree, Zechariah, Ben, and Jaaziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni,Eliab, and Benaiah, and Maaseiah, and Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, the doorkeepers.</para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />So the singers, Heman, Asaph, and Ethan, were appointed, with cymbals of brass to sound aloud;

<verse number="20" style="v" />and Zechariah, and Aziel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Unni, and Eliab, and Maaseiah, and Benaiah, with lutesset to Alamoth;

<verse number="21" style="v" />and Mattithiah, and Eliphelehu, and Mikneiah, and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, and Azaziah, with harps set to the Sheminith, tolead.

<verse number="22" style="v" />And Chenaniah, chief of the Levites, was over the song: he instructed about the song, because he was skilful.

<verse number="23" style="v" />And Berechiah and Elkanah were doorkeepers for the ark.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And Shebaniah, and Joshaphat, and Nethanel, and Amasai, and Zechariah, and Benaiah, and Eliezer, the priests, did blowthe trumpets before the ark of God; and Obed-edom and Jehiah were doorkeepers for the ark.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />So David, and the elders of Israel, and the captains over thousands, went to bring up the ark of the covenant of Jehovahout of the house of Obed-edom with joy.
