  <verse number="26" style="v" />And it came to pass, when God helped the Levites that bare the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, that they sacrificed sevenbullocks and seven rams.</para>

<verse number="27" style="v" />And David was clothed with a robe of fine linen, and all the Levites that bare the ark, and the singers, and Chenaniahthe master of the song with the singers: and David had upon him an ephod of linen.

<verse number="28" style="v" />Thus all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of Jehovah with shouting, and with sound of the cornet, and withtrumpets, and with cymbals, sounding aloud with lutes and harps.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />And it came to pass, as the ark of the covenant of Jehovah came to the city of David, that Michal the daughter of Saullooked out at the window, and saw king David dancing and playing; and she despised him in her heart.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And they brought in the ark of God, and set it in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it: and they offeredburnt offerings and peace-offerings before God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And when David had made an end of offering the burnt offering and the peace-offerings, he blessed the people in the nameof Jehovah.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And he dealt to every one of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a portionof flesh, and a cake of raisins.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And he appointed certain of the Levites to minister before the ark of Jehovah, and to celebrate and to thank and praiseJehovah, the God of Israel:

  <verse number="5" style="v" />Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, Jeiel, and Shemiramoth, and Jehiel, and Mattithiah, and Eliab, and Benaiah,and Obed-edom, and Jeiel, with lutes and with harps; and Asaph with cymbals, sounding aloud;

  <verse number="6" style="v" />and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests with trumpets continually, before the ark of the covenant of God.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Then on that day did David first ordain to give thanks to Jehovah, by the hand of Asaph and his brethren.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="8" style="v" />O give thanks to Jehovah, call upon his name;</para>

<para style="q1">Make known his doings among the peoples.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="9" style="v" />Sing to him, sing praises to him;</para>

<para style="q1">Talk you of all his marvelous works.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="10" style="v" />Glory you in his holy name;</para>

<para style="q1">Let the heart of them rejoice that seek Jehovah.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="11" style="v" />Seek you Jehovah and his strength;</para>

<para style="q1">Seek his face evermore.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="12" style="v" />Remember his marvelous works that he has done,</para>

<para style="q1">His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="13" style="v" />O you seed of Israel his servant,</para>

<para style="q1">You children of Jacob, his chosen ones.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="14" style="v" />He is Jehovah our God;</para>

<para style="q1">His judgments are in all the earth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="15" style="v" />Remember his covenant for ever,</para>

<para style="q1">The word which he commanded to a thousand generations,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="16" style="v" />The covenant which he made with Abraham,</para>

<para style="q1">And his oath to Isaac,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="17" style="v" />And confirmed the same to Jacob for a statute,</para>

<para style="q1">To Israel for an everlasting covenant,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="18" style="v" />Saying, To you will I give the land of Canaan,</para>

<para style="q1">The lot of your inheritance;</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="19" style="v" />When you were but a few men in number,</para>

<para style="q1">Yea, very few, and sojourners in it;</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="20" style="v" />And they went about from nation to nation,</para>

<para style="q1">And from one kingdom to another people.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="21" style="v" />He suffered no man to do them wrong;</para>

<para style="q1">Yea, he reproved kings for their sakes,</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="22" style="v" />Saying, Touch not mine anointed ones,</para>

<para style="q1">And do my prophets no harm.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="23" style="v" />Sing to Jehovah, all the earth;</para>

<para style="q1">Show forth his salvation from day to day.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="24" style="v" />Declare his glory among the nations,</para>

<para style="q1">His marvelous works among all the peoples.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="25" style="v" />For great is Jehovah, and greatly to be praised:</para>

<para style="q1">He also is to be feared above all gods.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="26" style="v" />For all the gods of the peoples are idols:</para>

<para style="q1">But Jehovah made the heavens.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="27" style="v" />Honor and majesty are before him:</para>

<para style="q1">Strength and gladness are in his place.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="28" style="v" />Ascribe to Jehovah, you kindred of the peoples,</para>

<para style="q1">Ascribe to Jehovah glory and strength;</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="29" style="v" />Ascribe to Jehovah the glory due to his name:</para>

<para style="q1">Bring an offering, and come before him;</para>

<para style="q1">Worship Jehovah in holy array.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="30" style="v" />Tremble before him, all the earth:</para>

<para style="q1">The world also is established that it cannot be moved.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="31" style="v" />Let the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice;</para>

<para style="q1">And let them say among the nations, Jehovah reigneth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="32" style="v" />Let the sea roar, and the fulness thereof;</para>

<para style="q1">Let the field exult, and all that is therein;</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="33" style="v" />Then shall the trees of the wood sing for joy before Jehovah;</para>

<para style="q1">For he comes to judge the earth.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="34" style="v" />O give thanks to Jehovah; for he is good;</para>

<para style="q1">For his lovingkindness endures for ever.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="35" style="v" />And say ye, Save us, O God of our salvation,</para>

<para style="q1">And gather us together and deliver us from the nations,</para>

<para style="q1">To give thanks to your holy name,</para>

<para style="q1">And to triumph in your praise.</para>

<para style="q1">

<verse number="36" style="v" />Blessed be Jehovah, the God of Israel,</para>

<para style="q1">From everlasting even to everlasting.And all the people said, Amen, and praised Jehovah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="37" style="v" />So he left there, before the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, Asaph and his brethren, to minister before the arkcontinually, as every day’s work required;

  <verse number="38" style="v" />and Obed-edom with their brethren, threescore and eight; Obed-edom also the son of Jeduthun and Hosah to be doorkeepers;

  <verse number="39" style="v" />and Zadok the priest, and his brethren the priests, before the tabernacle of Jehovah in the high place that was atGibeon,</para>

<verse number="40" style="v" />to offer burnt offerings to Jehovah upon the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according toall that is written in the law of Jehovah, which he commanded to Israel;

<verse number="41" style="v" />and with them Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest that were chosen, who were mentioned by name, to give thanks to Jehovah,because his lovingkindness endures for ever;

<verse number="42" style="v" />and with them Heman and Jeduthun with trumpets and cymbals for those that should sound aloud, andwith instruments for the songs of God; and the sons of Jeduthun to be at the gate.

<verse number="43" style="v" />And all the people departed every man to his house: and David returned to bless his house.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And it came to pass, when David lived in his house, that David said to Nathan the prophet, Lo, I dwell in a house ofcedar, but the ark of the covenant of Jehovah lives under curtains.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And Nathan said to David, Do all that is in your heart; for God is with thee.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />And it came to pass the same night, that the word of God came to Nathan, saying,

<verse number="4" style="v" />Go and tell David my servant, Thus says Jehovah, You shall not build me a house to dwell in:

<verse number="5" style="v" />for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, to this day, but have gone from tent to tent,and from one tabernacle to another.

<verse number="6" style="v" />In all places wherein I have walked with all Israel, did I speak a word with any of the judges of Israel, whom I commanded tobe shepherd of my people, saying, "Why have you not built me a house of cedar?"

<verse number="7" style="v" />Now therefore thus shall you say to my servant David, "Thus says Jehovah of hosts, 'I took you from the pasture, fromfollowing the sheep, that you should be prince over my people Israel.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And I have been with you wherever youwent, and have cut off all your enemies from before you. And I willmake you a name, like the name of the great ones of the earth.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And I will appoint a place for my people Israel and will plant them, so that they may dwell in their own place and be moved no more. And wicked men will not wear them out any more, as before,

<verse number="10" style="v" />and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel. And I will subdue all your enemies.Moreover I tell you that Yahweh will build you a house.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And it shall come to pass, when your days are fulfilled that you must go to be with your fathers, I will set up your seed after thee, who will be of your sons, and I will establish his kingdom.

<verse number="12" style="v" />He will build me a house, and I will establish his throne for ever.

<verse number="13" style="v" />I will a father to him, and he will be my son: and I will not take my lovingkindness away from him, as I took it from him that was before thee;

<verse number="14" style="v" />but I will settle him in my house and in my kingdom for ever; and his throne shall be established for ever.'"

<verse number="15" style="v" />According to all these words, and according to all this vision, Nathan spoke to David.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Then David the king went in, and sat before Jehovah; and he said, Who am I, O Jehovah God, and what is my house, thatyou have brought me thus far?

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And this was a small thing in your eyes, O God; but you have spoken of your servant’s house for a great while to come,and have regarded me according to the estate of a man of high degree, O Jehovah God.

  <verse number="18" style="v" />What can David say yet more to you concerning the honor which is done to your servant? for you know yourservant.</para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />O Jehovah, for your servant’s sake, and according to your own heart, have you wrought all this greatness, to make knownall these great things.

<verse number="20" style="v" />O Jehovah, there is none like thee, neither is there any God besides thee, according to all that we have heard with ourears.

<verse number="21" style="v" />And what one nation in the earth is like your people Israel, whom God went to redeem to himself for a people, to makeyou a name by great and terrible things, in driving out nations from before your people, whom you redeemest out of Egypt?

<verse number="22" style="v" />For your people Israel did you make your own people for ever; and you, Jehovah, became their God.

<verse number="23" style="v" />And now, O Jehovah, let the word that you have spoken concerning your servant, and concerning his house, be establishedfor ever, and do as you have spoken.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And let your name be established and magnified for ever, saying, Jehovah of hosts is the God of Israel, even a God toIsrael: and the house of David your servant is established before thee.

<verse number="25" style="v" />For you, O my God, have revealed to your servant that you will build him a house: therefore has your servant foundin his heart to pray before thee.

<verse number="26" style="v" />And now, O Jehovah, you are God, and have promised this good thing to your servant:

<verse number="27" style="v" />and now it has pleased you to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue for ever before you: for thou, OJehovah, have blessed, and it is blessed for ever.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And after this it came to pass, that David struck the Philistines, and subdued them, and took Gath and its towns out of the hand of the Philistines.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And he struck Moab; and the Moabites became servants to David, and brought tribute.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And David struck Hadarezer king of Zobah to Hamath, as he went to establish his dominion by the river Euphrates.

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And David took from him a thousand chariots, and seven thousand horsemen, and twenty thousand footmen; and David hamstrung all the chariot horses, but reserved enough of them for a hundred chariots.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="5" style="v" />And when the Syrians of Damascus came to succor Hadarezer king of Zobah, David struck two and twentythousand men of the Syrians .

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute.And Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.</para>

<verse number="7" style="v" />And David took the shields of gold that were on the servants of Hadarezer, and brought them to Jerusalem.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And from Tibhath and from Cun, cities of Hadarezer, David took very much brass, wherewith Solomon made the brazen sea, and the pillars, and the vessels of brass.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And when Toi king of Hamath heard that David had struck all the host of Hadadezer king of Zobah,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />he sent Hadoram his son to king David, to salute him, and to bless him, because he had fought against Hadadezer andstruck him (for Hadadezer had wars with Toi); and he had withhim all manner of vessels of gold and silver and brass.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />These also did king David dedicate to Yahweh, with the silver and the gold that he carried away from all the nations;from Edom, and from Moab, and from the children of Ammon, and from the Philistines, and from Amalek.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Moreover Abishai the son of Zeruiah struck of the Edomites in the Valley of Salt eighteen thousand.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />And he put garrisons in Edom; and all the Edomites became servants to David. And Jehovah gave victory to Davidwherever he went.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="14" style="v" />And David reigned over all Israel; and he executed justice and righteousness to all his people.

  <verse number="15" style="v" />And Joab the son of Zeruiah was over the host; and Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud was recorder;

  <verse number="16" style="v" />and Zadok the son of Ahitub, and Abimelech the son of Abiathar, were priests; and Shavsha was scribe;

  <verse number="17" style="v" />and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the Cherethites and the Pelethites; and the sons of David were chief about theking.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And it came to pass after this, that Nahash the king of the children of Ammon died, and his son reigned in his stead.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And David said, I will show kindness to Hanun the son of Nahash, because his father showed kindness to me. So David sentmessengers to comfort him concerning his father. And David’s servants came into the land of the children of Ammon to Hanun, tocomfort him.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Thinkest you that David does honor your father, in that he hassent comforters to you? are not his servants come to you to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />So Hanun took David’s servants, and shaved them, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, andsent them away.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Then there went certain persons, and told David how the men were served. And he sent to meet them; for the men weregreatly ashamed. And the king said, Tarry at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />And when the children of Ammon saw that they had made themselves odious to David, Hanun and the children of Ammon sent athousand talents of silver to hire them chariots and horsemen out of Mesopotamia, and out of Aram-maacah, and out of Zobah.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />So they hired them thirty and two thousand chariots, and the king of Maacah and his people, who came and encamped beforeMedeba. And the children of Ammon gathered themselves together from their cities, and came to battle.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />And when David heard of it, he sent Joab, and all the host of the mighty men.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And the children of Ammon came out, and put the battle in array at the gate of the city: and the kings that were come wereby themselves in the field.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Now when Joab saw that the battle was set against him before and behind, he chose of all the choice men of Israel, andput them in array against the Syrians.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />And the rest of the people he committed into the hand of Abishai his brother; and they put themselves in array againstthe children of Ammon.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />And he said, If the Syrians be too strong for me, then you shall help me; but if the children of Ammon be too strong forthee, then I will help thee.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Be of good courage, and let us play the man for our people, and for the cities of our God: and Jehovah do that whichseems him good.

<verse number="14" style="v" />So Joab and the people that were with him drew near before the Syrians to the battle; and they fled before him.

<verse number="15" style="v" />And when the children of Ammon saw that the Syrians were fled, they likewise fled before Abishai his brother, and enteredinto the city. Then Joab came to Jerusalem.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />And when the Syrians saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they sent messengers, and drew forth the Syriansthat were beyond the River, with Shophach the captain of the host of Hadarezer at their head.

  <verse number="17" style="v" />And it was told David; and he gathered all Israel together, and passed over the Jordan, and came upon them, and set thebattle in array against them. So when David had put the battle in array against the Syrians, they fought with him.</para>

<verse number="18" style="v" />And the Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed of the Syriansthe men of seven thousand chariots, and forty thousand footmen, and killed Shophach the captain of the host.

<verse number="19" style="v" />And when the servants of Hadarezer saw that they were put to the worse before Israel, they made peace with David, andserved him: neither would the Syrians help the children of Ammon any more.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And it came to pass, at the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go outto battle, that Joab led forth the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besiegedRabbah. But David tarried at Jerusalem. And Joab struck Rabbah, and overthrew it.</para>

<verse number="2" style="v" />And David took the crown of their king from off his head, and found it to weigh a talent of gold, and in it there were preciousstones; and it was set upon David’s head. And he brought forth the spoil of the city, exceeding much.

<verse number="3" style="v" />And he brought forth the people that were therein, and cut them with saws, and with harrows of iron, and with axes. And thus did David do to all the cities of the children of Ammon. And David and all the people returned to Jerusalem.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="4" style="v" />And it came to pass after this, that there arose war at Gezer with the Philistines: then Sibbecai the Hushathite killedSippai, of the sons of the giant; and they were subdued.

  <verse number="5" style="v" />And there was again war with the Philistines; and Elhanan the son of Jair killed Lahmi the brother of Goliath the Gittite,the staff of whose spear was like a weaver’s beam.</para>

<verse number="6" style="v" />And there was again war at Gath, where was a man of great stature, whose fingers and toes were four and twenty, sixon each hand, and six on each foot; and he also was born to the giant.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And when he defied Israel, Jonathan the son of Shimea David’s brother killed him.

<verse number="8" style="v" />These were born to the giant in Gath; and they fell by the hand of David, and by the hand of his servants.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And Satan stood up against Israel, and moved David to number Israel.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And David said to Joab and to the princes of the people, Go, number Israel from Beer-sheba even to Dan; and bring me word,that I may know the sum of them.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And Joab said, Yahweh make his people a hundred times as many as they are: but, my lord the king, are they not all mylord’s servants? why does my lord require this thing? why will he be a cause of guilt to Israel?</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Nevertheless the king’s word prevailed against Joab. Wherefore Joab departed, and went throughout all Israel, and came toJerusalem.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And Joab gave up the sum of the numbering of the people to David. And all they of Israel were a thousand thousand and ahundred thousand men that drew sword: and Judah was four hundred threescore and ten thousand men that drew sword.

<verse number="6" style="v" />But Levi and Benjamin counted he not among them; for the king’s word was abominable to Joab.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And God was displeased with this thing; therefore he struck Israel.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And David said to God, I have sinned greatly, in that I have done this thing: but now put away, I beseech thee, theiniquity of your servant; for I have done very foolishly.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And Yahweh spoke to Gad, David’s seer, saying,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Go and speak to David, saying, Thus says Yahweh, I offer you three things: choose you one of them, that I may do itto thee.</para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />So Gad came to David, and said to him, Thus says Yahweh, Take which you wilt:

<verse number="12" style="v" />either three years of famine; or three months to be consumed before your foes, while the sword of your enemies overtakeththee; or else three days the sword of Jehovah, even pestilence in the land, and the angel of Yahweh destroying throughout allthe borders of Israel. Now therefore consider what answer I shall return to him that sent me.

<verse number="13" style="v" />And David said to Gad, I am in a great strait: let me fall, I pray, into the hand of Yahweh; for very great are hismercies: and let me not fall into the hand of man.

<verse number="14" style="v" />So Yahweh sent a pestilence upon Israel; and there fell of Israel seventy thousand men.

<verse number="15" style="v" />And God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it: and as he was about to destroy, Yahweh beheld, and he repented himof the evil, and said to the destroying angel, It is enough; now stay your hand. And the angel of Yahweh was standing by thethreshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

<verse number="16" style="v" />And David lifted up his eyes, and saw the angel of Yahweh standing between earth and heaven, having a drawn sword in hishand stretched out over Jerusalem. Then David and the elders, clothed in sackcloth, fell upon their faces.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And David said to God, Is it not I that commanded the people to be numbered? even I it is that have sinned and donevery wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? let your hand, I pray thee, O Yahweh my God, be against me, and against myfather’s house; but not against your people, that they should be plagued.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Then the angel of Yahweh commanded Gad to say to David, that David should go up, and rear an altar to Yahweh in thethreshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />And David went up at the saying of Gad, which he spoke in the name of Yahweh.

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And Ornan turned back, and saw the angel; and his four sons that were with him hid themselves. Now Ornan was threshingwheat.</para>

<verse number="21" style="v" />And as David came to Ornan, Ornan looked and saw David, and went out of the threshing-floor, and bowed himself to Davidwith his face to the ground.

<verse number="22" style="v" />Then David said to Ornan, Give me the place of this threshing-floor, that I may build thereon an altar to Yahweh: forthe full price shall you give it me, that the plague may be stayed from the people.

<verse number="23" style="v" />And Ornan said to David, Take it to thee, and let my lord the king do that which is good in his eyes: lo, I giveyou the oxen for burnt-offerings, and the threshing instruments for wood, and the wheat for the grain offering; Igive it all.

<verse number="24" style="v" />And king David said to Ornan, Nay; but I will verily buy it for the full price: for I will not take that which is yourfor Yahweh, nor offer a burnt offering without cost.

<verse number="25" style="v" />So David gave to Ornan for the place six hundred shekels of gold by weight.

<verse number="26" style="v" />And David built there an altar to Yahweh, and offered burnt offerings and peace-offerings, and called upon Jehovah;and he answered him from heaven by fire upon the altar of burnt-offering.

<verse number="27" style="v" />And Yahweh commanded the angel; and he put up his sword again into the sheath thereof.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="28" style="v" />At that time, when David saw that Yahweh had answered him in the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite, then hesacrificed there.

  <verse number="29" style="v" />For the tabernacle of Yahweh, which Moses made in the wilderness, and the altar of burnt-offering, were at that time inthe high place at Gibeon.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />But David could not go before it to inquire of God; for he was afraid because of the sword of the angel of Yahweh.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Then David said, This is the house of Jehovah God, and this is the altar of burnt offering for Israel.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And David commanded to gather together the sojourners that were in the land of Israel; and he set masons to hew wroughtstones to build the house of God.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />And David prepared iron in abundance for the nails for the doors of the gates, and for the couplings; and brass inabundance without weight;

<verse number="4" style="v" />and cedar-trees without number: for the Sidonians and they of Tyre brought cedar-trees in abundance to David.

<verse number="5" style="v" />And David said, Solomon my son is young and tender, and the house that is to be builded for Jehovah must be exceedingmagnificent, of fame and of glory throughout all countries: I will therefore make preparation for it. So David preparedabundantly before his death.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then he called for Solomon his son, and charged him to build a house for Jehovah, the God of Israel.

  <verse number="7" style="v" />And David said to Solomon his son, As for me, it was in my heart to build a house to the name of Jehovah my God.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />But the word of Jehovah came to me, saying, You have shed blood abundantly, and have made great wars: you shall notbuild a house to my name, because you have shed much blood upon the earth in my sight.</para>

<verse number="9" style="v" />Behold, a son shall be born to thee, who shall be a man of rest; and I will give him rest from all his enemies roundabout; for his name shall be Solomon, and I will give peace and quietness to Israel in his days:

<verse number="10" style="v" />he shall build a house for my name; and he shall be my son, and I will be his father; and I will establish the throne ofhis kingdom over Israel for ever.

<verse number="11" style="v" />Now, my son, Jehovah be with thee; and prosper thou, and build the house of Jehovah your God, as he has spoken concerningthee.

<verse number="12" style="v" />Only Jehovah give you discretion and understanding, and give you charge concerning Israel; that so you may keep thelaw of Jehovah your God.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Then shall you prosper, if you observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which Jehovah charged Moses withconcerning Israel: be strong, and of good courage; fear not, neither be dismayed.

<verse number="14" style="v" />Now, behold, in my affliction I have prepared for the house of Jehovah a hundred thousand talents of gold, and a thousandthousand talents of silver, and of brass and iron without weight; for it is in abundance: timber also and stone have Iprepared; and you may add thereto.

<verse number="15" style="v" />Moreover there are workmen with you in abundance, hewers and workers of stone and timber, and all men that are skillfulin every manner of work:

<verse number="16" style="v" />of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and Jehovah be with thee.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="17" style="v" />David also commanded all the princes of Israel to help Solomon his son,saying,

  <verse number="18" style="v" />Is not Jehovah your God with you? and has he not given you rest on every side? for he has delivered the inhabitants ofthe land into my hand; and the land is subdued before Jehovah, and before his people.

  <verse number="19" style="v" />Now set your heart and your soul to seek after Jehovah your God; arise therefore, and build you the sanctuary of JehovahGod, to bring the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and the holy vessels of God, into the house that is to be built to the nameof Jehovah.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now David was old and full of days; and he made Solomon his son king over Israel.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And he gathered together all the princes of Israel, with the priests and the Levites.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And the Levites were numbered from thirty years old and upward: and their number by their polls, man by man, was thirtyand eight thousand.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Of these, twenty and four thousand were to oversee the work of the house of Jehovah; and six thousand were officers andjudges;

<verse number="5" style="v" />and four thousand were doorkeepers; and four thousand praised Jehovah with the instruments which I made,said David, to praise therewith.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And David divided them into courses according to the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Of the Gershonites: Ladan and Shimei.

  <verse number="8" style="v" />The sons of Ladan: Jehiel the chief, and Zetham, and Joel, three.

  <verse number="9" style="v" />The sons of Shimei: Shelomoth, and Haziel, and Haran, three. These were the heads of the fathers’houses of Ladan.</para>

<verse number="10" style="v" />And the sons of Shimei: Jahath, Zina, and Jeush, and Beriah. These four were the sons of Shimei.

<verse number="11" style="v" />And Jahath was the chief, and Zizah the second: but Jeush and Beriah had not many sons; therefore they became a fathers’house in one reckoning.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />The sons of Kohath: Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel, four.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />The sons of Amram: Aaron and Moses; and Aaron was separated, that he should sanctify the most holy things, he and hissons, for ever, to burn incense before Jehovah, to minister to him, and to bless in his name, for ever.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />But as for Moses the man of God, his sons were named among the tribe of Levi.</para>

<verse number="15" style="v" />The sons of Moses: Gershom and Eliezer.

<verse number="16" style="v" />The sons of Gershom: Shebuel the chief.

<verse number="17" style="v" />And the sons of Eliezer were: Rehabiah the chief; and Eliezer had no other sons; but the sons of Rehabiah were very many.

<verse number="18" style="v" />The sons of Izhar: Shelomith the chief.

<verse number="19" style="v" />The sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, and Jekameam the fourth.

<verse number="20" style="v" />The sons of Uzziel: Micah the chief, and Isshiah the second.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi. The sons of Mahli: Eleazar and Kish.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />And Eleazar died, and had no sons, but daughters only: and their brethren the sons of Kish took themto wife.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />The sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jeremoth, three.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="24" style="v" />These were the sons of Levi after their fathers’ houses, even the heads of the fathers’houses of those of them that were counted, in the number of names by their polls, who did the work for the service ofthe house of Jehovah, from twenty years old and upward.

  <verse number="25" style="v" />For David said, Jehovah, the God of Israel, has given rest to his people; and he lives in Jerusalem for ever:

  <verse number="26" style="v" />and also the Levites shall no more have need to carry the tabernacle and all the vessels of it for the service thereof.</para>

<verse number="27" style="v" />For by the last words of David the sons of Levi were numbered, from twenty years old and upward.

<verse number="28" style="v" />For their office was to wait on the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of Jehovah, in the courts, and in thechambers, and in the purifying of all holy things, even the work of the service of the house of God;

<verse number="29" style="v" />for the bread of the presence also, and for the fine flour for a grain offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which isbaked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all manner of measure and size;

<verse number="30" style="v" />and to stand every morning to thank and praise Jehovah, and likewise at even;

<verse number="31" style="v" />and to offer all burnt offerings to Jehovah, on the sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, in numberaccording to the ordinance concerning them, continually before Jehovah;

<verse number="32" style="v" />and that they should keep the charge of the tent of meeting, and the charge of the holy place, and the charge of the sonsof Aaron their brethren, for the service of the house of Jehovah.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And the courses of the sons of Aaron were these. The sons of Aaron: Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />But Nadab and Abihu died before their father, and had no children: therefore Eleazar and Ithamar executed the priest’soffice.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />And David with Zadok of the sons of Eleazar, and Ahimelech of the sons of Ithamar, divided them according to theirordering in their service.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />And there were more chief men found of the sons of Eleazar than of the sons of Ithamar; andthus were they divided: of the sons of Eleazar there were sixteen, heads of fathers’ houses; and of the sons ofIthamar, according to their fathers’ houses, eight.

<verse number="5" style="v" />Thus were they divided by lot, one sort with another; for there were princes of the sanctuary, and princes of God, both ofthe sons of Eleazar, and of the sons of Ithamar.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And Shemaiah the son of Nethanel the scribe, who was of the Levites, wrote them in the presence of the king, and theprinces, and Zadok the priest, and Ahimelech the son of Abiathar, and the heads of the fathers’houses of the priests and of the Levites; one fathers’ house being taken for Eleazar, and one taken for Ithamar.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="7" style="v" />Now the first lot came forth to Jehoiarib, the second to Jedaiah,

  <verse number="8" style="v" />the third to Harim, the fourth to Seorim,

  <verse number="9" style="v" />the fifth to Malchijah, the sixth to Mijamin,

  <verse number="10" style="v" />the seventh to Hakkoz, the eighth to Abijah,</para>

<verse number="11" style="v" />the ninth to Jeshua, the tenth to Shecaniah,

<verse number="12" style="v" />the eleventh to Eliashib, the twelfth to Jakim,

<verse number="13" style="v" />the thirteenth to Huppah, the fourteenth to Jeshebeab,

<verse number="14" style="v" />the fifteenth to Bilgah, the sixteenth to Immer,

<verse number="15" style="v" />the seventeenth to Hezir, the eighteenth to Happizzez,

<verse number="16" style="v" />the nineteenth to Pethahiah, the twentieth to Jehezkel,

<verse number="17" style="v" />the one and twentieth to Jachin, the two and twentieth to Gamul,

<verse number="18" style="v" />the three and twentieth to Delaiah, the four and twentieth to Maaziah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />This was the ordering of them in their service, to come into the house of Jehovah according to the ordinancegiven to them by Aaron their father, as Jehovah, the God of Israel, had commanded him.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And of the rest of the sons of Levi: of the sons of Amram, Shubael; of the sons of Shubael, Jehdeiah.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />Of Rehabiah: of the sons of Rehabiah, Isshiah the chief.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />Of the Izharites, Shelomoth; of the sons of Shelomoth, Jahath.</para>

<verse number="23" style="v" />And the sons of Hebron: Jeriah the chief, Amariah the second, Jahaziel the third, Jekameam thefourth.

<verse number="24" style="v" />The sons of Uzziel, Micah; of the sons of Micah, Shamir.

<verse number="25" style="v" />The brother of Micah, Isshiah; of the sons of Isshiah, Zechariah.

<verse number="26" style="v" />The sons of Merari: Mahli and Mushi; the sons of Jaaziah: Beno.

<verse number="27" style="v" />The sons of Merari: of Jaaziah, Beno, and Shoham, and Zaccur, and Ibri.

<verse number="28" style="v" />Of Mahli: Eleazar, who had no sons.

<verse number="29" style="v" />Of Kish; the sons of Kish: Jerahmeel.

<verse number="30" style="v" />And the sons of Mushi: Mahli, and Eder, and Jerimoth. These were the sons of the Levites after their fathers’ houses.

<verse number="31" style="v" />These likewise cast lots even as their brethren the sons of Aaron in the presence of David the king, and Zadok, andAhimelech, and the heads of the fathers’ houses of the priests and of the Levites; the fathers’houses of the chief even as those of his younger brother.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Moreover David and the captains of the host set apart for the service certain of the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and ofJeduthun, who should prophesy with harps, with psalteries, and with cymbals: and the number of them that did the work accordingto their service was:

  <verse number="2" style="v" />of the sons of Asaph: Zaccur, and Joseph, and Nethaniah, and Asharelah, the sons of Asaph, under the hand of Asaph, whoprophesied after the order of the king.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Of Jeduthun; the sons of Jeduthun: Gedaliah, and Zeri, and Jeshaiah, Hashabiah, and Mattithiah, six, under the hands oftheir father Jeduthun with the harp, who prophesied in giving thanks and praising Jehovah.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />Of Heman; the sons of Heman: Bukkiah, Mattaniah, Uzziel, Shebuel, and Jerimoth, Hananiah, Hanani, Eliathah, Giddalti, andRomamti-ezer, Joshbekashah, Mallothi, Hothir, Mahazioth.

<verse number="5" style="v" />All these were the sons of Heman the king’s seer in the words of God, to lift up the horn. And God gave to Heman fourteensons and three daughters.

<verse number="6" style="v" />All these were under the hands of their father for song in the house of Jehovah, with cymbals, psalteries, and harps, forthe service of the house of God; Asaph, Jeduthun, and Heman being under the order of the king.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And the number of them, with their brethren that were instructed in singing to Jehovah, even all that were skilful, wastwo hundred fourscore and eight.

<verse number="8" style="v" />And they cast lots for their offices, all alike, as well the small as the great, the teacher as the scholar.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />Now the first lot came forth for Asaph to Joseph: the second to Gedaliah; he and his brethren and sons were twelve:

  <verse number="10" style="v" />the third to Zaccur, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

  <verse number="11" style="v" />the fourth to Izri, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

  <verse number="12" style="v" />the fifth to Nethaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />the sixth to Bukkiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="14" style="v" />the seventh to Jesharelah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="15" style="v" />the eighth to Jeshaiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="16" style="v" />the ninth to Mattaniah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="17" style="v" />the tenth to Shimei, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="18" style="v" />the eleventh to Azarel, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="19" style="v" />the twelfth to Hashabiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="20" style="v" />for the thirteenth, Shubael, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="21" style="v" />for the fourteenth, Mattithiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="22" style="v" />for the fifteenth to Jeremoth, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="23" style="v" />for the sixteenth to Hananiah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="24" style="v" />for the seventeenth to Joshbekashah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="25" style="v" />for the eighteenth to Hanani, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="26" style="v" />for the nineteenth to Mallothi, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="27" style="v" />for the twentieth to Eliathah, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="28" style="v" />for the one and twentieth to Hothir, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="29" style="v" />for the two and twentieth to Giddalti, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="30" style="v" />for the three and twentieth to Mahazioth, his sons and his brethren, twelve:

<verse number="31" style="v" />for the four and twentieth to Romamtiezer, his sons and his brethren, twelve.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />For the courses of the doorkeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the first-born, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth,

  <verse number="3" style="v" />Elam the fifth, Jehohanan the sixth, Eliehoenai the seventh.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />And Obed-edom had sons: Shemaiah the first-born, Jehozabad the second, Joah the third, and Sacar the fourth, and Nethanelthe fifth,

<verse number="5" style="v" />Ammiel the sixth, Issachar the seventh, Peullethai the eighth; for God blessed him.

<verse number="6" style="v" />Also to Shemaiah his son were sons born, that ruled over the house of their father; for they were mighty men of valor.

<verse number="7" style="v" />The sons of Shemaiah: Othni, and Rephael, and Obed, Elzabad, whose brethren were valiant men, Elihu, and Semachiah.

<verse number="8" style="v" />All these were of the sons of Obed-edom: they and their sons and their brethren, able men in strength for the service;threescore and two of Obed-edom.

<verse number="9" style="v" />And Meshelemiah had sons and brethren, valiant men, eighteen.

<verse number="10" style="v" />Also Hosah, of the children of Merari, had sons: Shimri the chief (for though he was not the first-born, yet his fathermade him chief),

<verse number="11" style="v" />Hilkiah the second, Tebaliah the third, Zechariah the fourth: all the sons and brethren of Hosah were thirteen.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="12" style="v" />Of these were the courses of the doorkeepers, even of the chief men, having offices like their brethren, to minister inthe house of Jehovah.

  <verse number="13" style="v" />And they cast lots, as well the small as the great, according to their fathers’ houses, for every gate.

  <verse number="14" style="v" />And the lot eastward fell to Shelemiah. Then for Zechariah his son, a discreet counsellor, they cast lots; and his lotcame out northward.</para>

<verse number="15" style="v" />To Obed-edom southward; and to his sons the store-house.

<verse number="16" style="v" />To Shuppim and Hosah westward, by the gate of Shallecheth, at the causeway that goes up, watch against watch.

<verse number="17" style="v" />Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the store-house two and two.

<verse number="18" style="v" />For Parbar westward, four at the causeway, and two at Parbar.

<verse number="19" style="v" />These were the courses of the doorkeepers; of the sons of the Korahites, and of the sons of Merari.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And of the Levites, Ahijah was over the treasures of the house of God, and over the treasures of the dedicated things.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />The sons of Ladan, the sons of the Gershonites belonging to Ladan, the heads of the fathers’houses belonging to Ladan the Gershonite: Jehieli.

  <verse number="22" style="v" />The sons of Jehieli: Zetham, and Joel his brother, over the treasures of the house of Jehovah.</para>

<verse number="23" style="v" />Of the Amramites, of the Izharites, of the Hebronites, of the Uzzielites:

<verse number="24" style="v" />and Shebuel the son of Gershom, the son of Moses, was ruler over the treasures.

<verse number="25" style="v" />And his brethren: of Eliezer came Rehabiah his son, and Jeshaiah his son, and Joram his son, and Zichri hisson, and Shelomoth his son.

<verse number="26" style="v" />This Shelomoth and his brethren were over all the treasures of the dedicated things, which David the king, and the headsof the fathers’ houses, the captains over thousands and hundreds, and the captains of the host, had dedicated.

<verse number="27" style="v" />Out of the spoil won in battles did they dedicate to repair the house of Jehovah.

<verse number="28" style="v" />And all that Samuel the seer, and Saul the son of Kish, and Abner the son of Ner, and Joab the son of Zeruiah, haddedicated, whoever had dedicated anything, it was under the hand of Shelomoth, and of his brethren.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="29" style="v" />Of the Izharites, Chenaniah and his sons were for the outward business over Israel, for officers and judges.

  <verse number="30" style="v" />Of the Hebronites, Hashabiah and his brethren, men of valor, a thousand and seven hundred, had the oversight of Israelbeyond the Jordan westward, for all the business of Jehovah, and for the service of the king.</para>

<verse number="31" style="v" />Of the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers’houses. In the forties year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty menof valor at Jazer of Gilead.

<verse number="32" style="v" />And his brethren, men of valor, were two thousand and seven hundred, heads of fathers’houses, whom king David made overseers over the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half-tribe of the Manassites,for every matter pertaining to God, and for the affairs of the king.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />Now the children of Israel after their number, to wit, the heads of fathers’houses and the captains of thousands and of hundreds, and their officers that served the king, in any matter of thecourses which came in and went out month by month throughout all the months of the year-of every course were twenty and fourthousand.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Over the first course for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his course were twenty and fourthousand.

  <verse number="3" style="v" />He was of the children of Perez, the chief of all the captains of the host for the first month.</para>

<verse number="4" style="v" />And over the course of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and his course; and Mikloth the ruler: and in his coursewere twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="5" style="v" />The third captain of the host for the third month was Benaiah, the son of Jehoiada the priest, chief: and in his coursewere twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="6" style="v" />This is that Benaiah, who was the mighty man of the thirty, and over the thirty: andof his course was Ammizabad his son.

<verse number="7" style="v" />The fourth captain for the fourth month was Asahel the brother of Joab, and Zebadiah his son after him: and inhis course were twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="8" style="v" />The fifth captain for the fifth month was Shamhuth the Izrahite: and in his course were twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="9" style="v" />The sixth captain for the sixth month was Ira the son of Ikkesh the Tekoite: and in his course were twenty andfour thousand.

<verse number="10" style="v" />The seventh captain for the seventh month was Helez the Pelonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in his coursewere twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="11" style="v" />The eighth captain for the eighth month was Sibbecai the Hushathite, of the Zerahites: and in his course weretwenty and four thousand.

<verse number="12" style="v" />The ninth captain for the ninth month was Abiezer the Anathothite, of the Benjamites: and in his course weretwenty and four thousand.

<verse number="13" style="v" />The tenth captain for the tenth month was Maharai the Netophathite, of the Zerahites: and in his course weretwenty and four thousand.

<verse number="14" style="v" />The eleventh captain for the eleventh month was Benaiah the Pirathonite, of the children of Ephraim: and in hiscourse were twenty and four thousand.

<verse number="15" style="v" />The twelfth captain for the twelfth month was Heldai the Netophathite, of Othniel: and in his course weretwenty and four thousand.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="16" style="v" />Furthermore over the tribes of Israel: of the Reubenites was Eliezer the son of Zichri the ruler: of the Simeonites,Shephatiah the son of Maacah:

  <verse number="17" style="v" />of Levi, Hashabiah the son of Kemuel: of Aaron, Zadok:

  <verse number="18" style="v" />of Judah, Elihu, one of the brethren of David: of Issachar, Omri the son of Michael:</para>

<verse number="19" style="v" />of Zebulun, Ishmaiah the son of Obadiah: of Naphtali, Jeremoth the son of Azriel:

<verse number="20" style="v" />of the children of Ephraim, Hoshea the son of Azaziah: of the half-tribe of Manasseh, Joel the son of Pedaiah:

<verse number="21" style="v" />of the half-tribe of Manasseh in Gilead, Iddo the son of Zechariah: of Benjamin, Jaasiel the son of Abner:

<verse number="22" style="v" />of Dan, Azarel the son of Jeroham. These were the captains of the tribes of Israel.

<verse number="23" style="v" />But David took not the number of them from twenty years old and under, because Jehovah had said he would increase Israellike to the stars of heaven.

<verse number="24" style="v" />Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but finished not; and there came wrath for this upon Israel; neither was thenumber put into the account in the chronicles of king David.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="25" style="v" />And over the king’s treasures was Azmaveth the son of Adiel: and over the treasures in the fields, in the cities, and inthe villages, and in the castles, was Jonathan the son of Uzziah:

  <verse number="26" style="v" />And over them that did the work of the field for tillage of the ground was Ezri the son of Chelub:

  <verse number="27" style="v" />and over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: and over the increase of the vineyards for the wine-cellars was Zabdithe Shiphmite:</para>

<verse number="28" style="v" />and over the olive-trees and the sycomore-trees that were in the lowland was Baal-hanan the Gederite: and over thecellars of oil was Joash:

<verse number="29" style="v" />and over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphatthe son of Adlai:

<verse number="30" style="v" />and over the camels was Obil the Ishmaelite: and over the asses was Jehdeiah the Meronothite: and over the flocks wasJaziz the Hagrite.

<verse number="31" style="v" />All these were the rulers of the substance which was king David’s.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="32" style="v" />Also Jonathan, David’s uncle, was a counsellor, a man of understanding, and a scribe: and Jehiel the son of Hachmoni waswith the king’s sons:

  <verse number="33" style="v" />And Ahithophel was the king’s counsellor: and Hushai the Archite was the king’s friend:

  <verse number="34" style="v" />and after Ahithophel was Jehoiada the son of Benaiah, and Abiathar: and the captain of the king’s host was Joab.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And David assembled all the princes of Israel, the princes of the tribes, and the captains of the companies that servedthe king by course, and the captains of thousands, and the captains of hundreds, and the rulers over all the substance andpossessions of the king and of his sons, with the officers, and the mighty men, even all the mighty men of valor, toJerusalem.</para>

<verse number="2" style="v" />Then David the king stood up upon his feet, and said, Hear me, my brethren, and my people: as for me, it was in my heartto build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of Jehovah, and for the footstool of our God; and I had made ready for thebuilding.

<verse number="3" style="v" />But God said to me, You shall not build a house for my name, because you are a man of war, and have shed blood.

<verse number="4" style="v" />Howbeit Jehovah, the God of Israel, chose me out of all the house of my father to be king over Israel for ever: for hehas chosen Judah to be prince; and in the house of Judah, the house of my father; and among the sons of my father he tookpleasure in me to make me king over all Israel;

<verse number="5" style="v" />And of all my sons (for Jehovah has given me many sons), he has chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of thekingdom of Jehovah over Israel.

<verse number="6" style="v" />And he said to me, Solomon your son, he shall build my house and my courts; for I have chosen him to be my son, and Iwill be his father.

<verse number="7" style="v" />And I will establish his kingdom for ever, if he be constant to do my commandments and mine ordinances, as at this day.

<verse number="8" style="v" />Now therefore, in the sight of all Israel, the assembly of Jehovah, and in the audience of our God, observe and seek outall the commandments of Jehovah your God; that you may possess this good land, and leave it for an inheritance to your childrenafter you for ever.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="9" style="v" />And you, Solomon my son, know you the God of your father, and serve him with a perfect heart and with a willing mind; forJehovah searcheth all hearts, and understands all the imaginations of the youghts: if you seek him, he will be found ofyou; but if you forsake him, he will cast you off for ever.

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Take heed now; for Jehovah has chosen you to build a house for the sanctuary: be strong, and do it.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Then David gave to Solomon his son the pattern of the porchof the temple, and of the houses thereof, and of the treasuries thereof, and of the upper rooms thereof, and of theinner chambers thereof, and of the place of the atonement lid;

  <verse number="12" style="v" />and the pattern of all that he had by the Spirit, for the courts of the house of Jehovah, and for all the chambers roundabout, for the treasuries of the house of God, and for the treasuries of the dedicated things;</para>

<verse number="13" style="v" />also for the courses of the priests and the Levites, and for all the work of the service of the house of Jehovah, and forall the vessels of service in the house of Jehovah;

<verse number="14" style="v" />of gold by weight for the vessels of gold, for all vessels of every kind of service;of silver for all the vessels of silver by weight, for all vessels of every kind of service;

<verse number="15" style="v" />by weight also for the candlesticks of gold, and for the lamps thereof, of gold, by weight for every candlestick and forthe lamps thereof; and for the candlesticks of silver, silver by weight forevery candlestick and for the lamps thereof, according to the use of every candlestick;

<verse number="16" style="v" />and the gold by weight for the tables of the bread of the presence, for every table; and silver for the tables of silver;

<verse number="17" style="v" />and the flesh-hooks, and the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; andfor the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;

<verse number="18" style="v" />and for the altar of incense refined gold by weight; and gold for the pattern of the chariot,even the cherubim, that spread out their wings, and covered the ark of the covenant of Jehovah.

<verse number="19" style="v" />All this, said David, have I been made to understand in writing from the hand of Jehovah, even all the works ofthis pattern.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And David said to Solomon his son, Be strong and of good courage, and do it: fear not, nor be dismayed; for Jehovah God,even my God, is with thee; he will not fail thee, nor forsake thee, until all the work for the service of the house of Jehovahbe finished.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />And, behold, there are the courses of the priests and the Levites, for all the service of the house of God: and thereshall be with you in all manner of work every willing man that has skill, for any manner of service: also the captains andall the people will be wholly at your commandment.</para>

<para style="p">

  <verse number="1" style="v" />And David the king said to all the assembly, Solomon my son, whom alone God has chosen, is yet young and tender, andthe work is great; for the palace is not for man, but for Jehovah God.

  <verse number="2" style="v" />Now I have prepared with all my might for the house of my God the gold for thethings of gold, and the silver for the things of silver, and the brass for thethings of brass, the iron for the things of iron, and wood for thethings of wood; onyx stones, and stones to be set, stones for inlaid work, and of various colors, and allmanner of precious stones, and marble stones in abundance.</para>

<verse number="3" style="v" />Moreover also, because I have set my affection on the house of my God, seeing that I have a treasure of mine own of goldand silver, I give it to the house of my God, over and above all that I have prepared for the holy house,

<verse number="4" style="v" />even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, wherewith tooverlay the walls of the houses;

<verse number="5" style="v" />of gold for the things of gold, and of silver for thethings of silver, and for all manner of work to be madeby the hands of artificers. Who then offers willingly to consecrate himself this day to Jehovah?

<para style="p">

  <verse number="6" style="v" />Then the princes of the fathers’ houses, and the princes of the tribes of Israel, and the captains of thousandsand of hundreds, with the rulers over the king’s work, offered willingly;

  <verse number="7" style="v" />and they gave for the service of the house of God of gold five thousand talents and ten thousand darics, and of silver tenthousand talents, and of brass eighteen thousand talents, and of iron a hundred thousand talents.</para>

<verse number="8" style="v" />And they with whom precious stones were found gave them to the treasure of the house of Jehovah, under the handof Jehiel the Gershonite.

<verse number="9" style="v" />Then the people rejoiced, for that they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to Jehovah:and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="10" style="v" />Wherefore David blessed Jehovah before all the assembly; and David said, Blessed be thou, O Jehovah, the God of Israelour father, for ever and ever.

  <verse number="11" style="v" />Thine, O Jehovah, is the greatness, and the power, and the glory, and the victory, and the majesty: for all that is inthe heavens and in the eareh is your; your is the kingdom, O Jehovah, and you are exalted as head above all.</para>

<verse number="12" style="v" />Both riches and honor come of thee, and you rule over all; and in your hand is power and might; and in your hand it isto make great, and to give strength to all.

<verse number="13" style="v" />Now therefore, our God, we thank thee, and praise your glorious name.

<verse number="14" style="v" />But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able to offer so willingly after this sort? for all things come ofthee, and of your own have we given thee.

<verse number="15" style="v" />For we are strangers before thee, and sojourners, as all our fathers were: our days on the earth are as a shadow, andthere is no abiding.

<verse number="16" style="v" />O Jehovah our God, all this store that we have prepared to build you a house for your holy name comes of your hand, andis all your own.

<verse number="17" style="v" />I know also, my God, that you triest the heart, and have pleasure in uprightness. As for me, in the uprightness of myheart I have willingly offered all these things: and now have I seen with joy your people, that are present here, offerwillingly to thee.

<verse number="18" style="v" />O Jehovah, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this for ever in the imagination of thethoughts of the heart of your people, and prepare their heart to thee;

<verse number="19" style="v" />and give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, and to do allthese things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="20" style="v" />And David said to all the assembly, Now bless Jehovah your God. And all the assembly blessed Jehovah, the God of theirfathers, and bowed down their heads, and worshipped Jehovah, and the king.

  <verse number="21" style="v" />And they sacrificed sacrifices to Jehovah, and offered burnt offerings to Jehovah, on the morrow after that day, evena thousand bullocks, a thousand rams, and a thousand lambs, with their drink-offerings, and sacrifices in abundance for allIsrael,</para>

<verse number="22" style="v" />and did eat and drink before Jehovah on that day with great gladness.

<para style="p">And they made Solomon the son of David king the second time, and anointed him to Jehovah to be prince, and Zadok to bepriest.

  <verse number="23" style="v" />Then Solomon sat on the throne of Jehovah as king instead of David his father, and prospered; and all Israel obeyed him.</para>

<verse number="24" style="v" />And all the princes, and the mighty men, and all the sons likewise of king David, submitted themselves to Solomon theking.

<verse number="25" style="v" />And Jehovah magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel, and bestowed upon him such royal majesty as had notbeen on any king before him in Israel.

<para style="p">

  <verse number="26" style="v" />Now David the son of Jesse reigned over all Israel.

  <verse number="27" style="v" />And the time that he reigned over Israel was forty years; seven years reigned he in Hebron, and thirty and threeyears reigned he in Jerusalem.</para>

<verse number="28" style="v" />And he died in a good old age, full of days, riches, and honor: and Solomon his son reigned in his stead.

<verse number="29" style="v" />Now the acts of David the king, first and last, behold, they are written in the history of Samuel the seer, and in thehistory of Nathan the prophet, and in the history of Gad the seer,

<verse number="30" style="v" />with all his reign and his might, and the times that went over him, and over Israel, and over all the kingdoms of thecountries.
